programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Newly retired Sue Garbutt from Devon seeks a property in the Alicante area. Meanwhile, 150 miles south, Neil Street-Bailey looks to swap the rat race for a Spanish residence.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: South African couple Gary and Dawn are seeking a permanent home in Spain, with plenty of outdoor space for a barbecue, while art consultant Amy wants a holiday home in Almeria.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert visits the Wirral, where Dave and Gemma's five-bedroom semi-detached home looks like a student residence, and in Marsden, West Yorkshire, Malcolm and Muriel need to modernise their house to give them a good chance of securing a sale.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Shane Evans, COO and co-founder of massage therapy chain Massage Heights, poses as a contestant on a TV reality show who is trying fund her own business. After spending nine years moulding the company, she decides to find out first-hand how her retreats are doing so she can fix potential problems before expanding the business to 300 new locations.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Former undercover bosses, including the co-owner of a frozen yoghurt company and the chief executive of a sports bar and grill, want to take another look at the everyday workings of their businesses, but fear they will be recognised. They each send an employee in their place to report on how their firms are functioning.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Edinburgh lovebirds Andy and Pim hope to impress guests Jimmy and Jas and Stuart and Jack, with a Scottish and Thai-themed menu, with a bit of American thrown in for good measure.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Things do not run smoothly for three Bournemouth couples, as one pair are late with their cooking, talk of butchering causes upset and a pescatarian is accidentally served meat.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a restaurant in Mount Sinai, New York, which appears to be stuck in the 1980s. The crumbling decor and unenthusiastic head chef at the Handlebar need to be tackled, but owners Bill and Carolyn LeRoy are in denial about the problems they face.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to the upmarket quarter of Hollywood to help the owner of failing health-food restaurant Sante La Brea. As well as struggling to control his disrespectful staff, the proprietor receives a surprise visit from the police at the height of dinner service.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a couple who are torn between two vibrant cities. While Cliff would like to move to Brighton, Sue dreams of living in Montpellier, southern France, where she would like to open a B&B.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples who struggled to find their first marital home, including Rupreet and Sundeep who had their hearts set on a specific area in Harrow. Phil also revisits Paul and Elly, who searched for a property in Bristol, to see if they found the perfect house.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Stomp, a 13-year-old male okapi, is being encouraged to mate with younger female K'Tusha. But on his first attempt, he snaps his horn and causes K'Tusha a minor injury. Cameras at Chester Zoo also follow African painted dogs as they compete to be pack leader, and Raja the Bornean river turtle meets two prospective mates.(n)

programme.title: Auction of a Lifetime
programme.sub-title: Marilyn Monroe: Auction of a Lifetime.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring Marilyn Monroe's life story, told through some of her most personal and glamorous possessions, and interviews with those who knew her well. The programme focuses on an auction that took place in November 2016 in Los Angeles, where many of the Hollywood icon's most sought-after belongings were sold.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the complications of bereavement in the Rockland community. Melinda and Anazella's husband Jim recently died of cancer. His dying wish was for his brother Abel to marry his two widows and bring up his seven children - but Abel has three wives already, and the prospect of further upheaval is daunting for them. Although Jim's death has united Melinda and Anazella in grief, they must now choose whether to stay together as a family and risk living through the heartache of plural marriage again, or go their own way.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr returns with the hybrid panel quiz show, putting a comedy spin on Channel 4's long-running words-and-numbers game. This time, guest team captain David Walliams joins forces with Jonathan Ross, while Jon Richardson teams up with Joe Lycett. Isy Suttie joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley takes care of the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Opinionated TV viewers share their critiques of Kitchen 999: Emergency Chefs, the final of The Voice, Alone with the In-Laws, Line of Duty, Life Story, One Born Every Minute and the News.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The popular armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring Line of Duty, University Challenge, Rio Ferdinand: Being Mum and Dad, Comic Relief, Broadchurch, One Night with my Ex, All Round to Mrs Brown's and the News.(n)

programme.title: 16 Kids and Counting
programme.desc: Cameras return to the Radfords family home as Lancashire pie-maker Noel, Sue and the children prepare to welcome a new baby to their ever-growing brood and only weeks later set off on their most ambitious family holiday to date. In Australia, the Radfords meet that nation's biggest family, the Bonnells, who have 16 kids but enforce much stricter house rules. As the Radfords explore Australia's Gold Coast, cooking kangaroo pies for their hosts and falling out with each other on the other side of the world.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A couple who have spent their lives saving stray animals bring in a three-legged cat called Jersey, who has recently become lame in her single back leg. The vet must decide whether the first-ever hip replacement on a three-legged cat is viable. Plus, a Great Dane that is two metres long is given a custom-designed spinal implant, and a Dogue de Bordeaux gets help with elbow dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Greg Miller, CEO of the Larry H Miller Group of Companies and co-owner of National Basketball Association team the Utah Jazz, goes undercover. Since his dad died he has made many changes to the organisation, and posing as a contestant on a reality TV competition to win a dream job, he works among his own staff to see if his father's legacy still lives on.(n)

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and comedian Rhod Gilbert spend 48 hours in Florida's largest city, for a densely packed mini-break including art, art deco slobbing, alligators, yoga, speedboats and dominoes. They also squeeze in an airboat tour of the Florida Everglades and a trip to Little Havana.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a married couple who cannot decide whether to buy a property in Provence or Keswick. While Enid has been dreaming of life in the south of France for as long as she can remember, Dennis is more interested in the scenery of the Lake District.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Businesswoman Karen would like to invest in a property and has a flexible budget of £280,000. Karen is torn: her heart is pulling her towards a new life abroad, but her adult daughter Danielle wishes her to remain in Britain. While Jasmine Harman finds her some tempting offers in Chamonix in the French Alps, Jonnie Irwin shows her the trendy east side of London.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Triathletes Ron and Mel plan to sell their family home and buy two new properties with the proceeds. The pair look for a small house in the area of Kent where they already live and a ski chalet in the Les Gets area of France, where they want to enjoy winter and summer sports with friends and family.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Wiltshire couple Martin and Michelle MacClay want a holiday home in France's Loire Valley, so Scarlette Douglas helps find them the perfect property on a budget of £73,000.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and Steve try to find a buyer for financial adviser Ray and his girlfriend Eve, while Casas Manuel is helping Brian and Esther from Glasgow to find a home in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: David and Pam Rowe are searching for their dream retirement home, so Spanish Property Choice line three apartments up for them to see within their 110,000 euro budget.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A couple search for a home big enough for them and their eight children in Alicante, and the agency takes on a huge property that includes a luxurious cat hotel in the basement.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to help a struggling seafood restaurant in Manhattan, where the three owners regularly come into conflict as they each try to assert their authority over the business, causing confusion for all. When one of the trio stubbornly resists the changes the Scottish chef is hoping to implement, sparks begin to fly.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Fiery chef Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a mother-and-son team who have gone through 20 chefs in two years at their struggling Italian restaurant in California. The adjoining bar is a triumph, but the oldest dining establishment in town needs an overhaul if the inexperienced owners are to make a profit.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to West Nyack, New York, to come to the aid of a family-run Mexican restaurant that is suffering a financial crisis, and a case of hard-headed patriarchy. When the chef arrives he finds himself turfing out the existing customers for their own safety due to a cockroach infestation on the premises.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to La Grange, a suburb of Chicago, to help the owners of Cafe 36, an upmarket bistro threatening to destroy the marriage of its owners due to the scale of their financial losses. The head chef's attitude to quality control is driving customers away, and it is up to Gordon Ramsay to turn the business around.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary giving an insight into cash-strapped Britain from the perspectives of debtors, creditors and those who collect the payments, including High Court enforcement bailiffs and repossession teams. Drama based on VC Andrews' novel, starring Heather Graham and Ellen Burstyn.(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing
programme.desc: A superb ensemble cast---including Matthew McConaughey, John Turturro, Alan Arkin and Amy Irving---is featured in this penetrating drama about several unfulfilled New Yorkers whose lives intersect. The perceptive, intricately plotted script explores the different ways people search for happiness. David Connelly, Clea DuVall(n)

programme.title: Riding in Cars With Boys
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore is a bright, ambitious teenager, determined to escape her working class background with parents James Woods and Lorraine Bracco. But on the rebound from a crush, she falls for and falls pregnant by Steve Zahn, an amiable but not-too-bright boy. At 16, she's a wife and a mother, still determined to finish college but weighed down by responsibility. Penny Marshall's film, told in flashback, is based on Beverly D'Onfrio's book of her struggle to become a writer(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Comic road movie starring Wesley Snipes and Patrick Swayze about three New York drag queens who win a trip to Hollywood and set out on a life-changing journey across the USA(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: In an alternate Victorian Age world, a group of famous contemporary fantasy, SF and adventure characters team up on a secret mission(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: A woman on the lam with her young daughter takes drastic steps when her abusive husband tracks them down(n)

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Patrick Swayze leads this action movie as a bouncer who tries to bring order to a rowdy Mid West bar(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: Painfully shy Todd Anderson has been sent to the school where his popular older brother was valedictorian. His room-mate, Neil, although exceedingly bright and popular, is very much under the thumb of his overbearing father. The two, along with their other friends, meet Professor Keating who tells them of the Dead Poets Society, and encourages them to go against the status quo. Each, in his own way, does this, and is changed for life(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Samuel L Jackson plays the eponymous hero in John Singleton's tough thriller, an ex-cop who sets out to nail Christian Bale, a killer using his rich kid connections to escape conviction. But as Shaft's net draws tighter, he has to contend with killers employed by a desperate Bale(n)

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: A New York drug dealer is pursued by a determined cop(n)

programme.title: Suicide Kings
programme.desc: In this hip crime drama, a spoiled rich teen's (Henry Thomas) sister is abducted, and he and his punk friends decide to kidnap an ex-mob boss (Christopher Walken) as a negotiating tool. But the wily mobster turns the tables on his bungling captors. Denis Leary, Sean Patrick Flanery, Jay Mohr, Jeremy Sisto, Laura San Giacomo(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: Hit comedy set on an American college campus in the early 60s, focusing on the outrageous escapades of the Delta fraternity - a house full of beer-swilling party animals. The college dean wants them out and enlists the help of snobbish students from a rival fraternity, leaving the Deltas to use all their wit, cunning and downright deviousness to avoid being thrown off campus(n)

programme.title: Raising Arizona
programme.desc: A dimwitted criminal kidnaps a baby that belongs to a wealthy local businessman in order to make his depressed wife who is unable to have children of her own happy. Soon he finds himself on the run from the police, old criminal acquaintances, and a mysterious motorcycle-riding madman(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: Steve Martin, one of the funniest men on the planet, is at the top of his game in this frantic comedy about a man's search for the perfect woman. He's got the brain, he just needs to find a body..(n)

programme.title: Rocket Science
programme.desc: Jeffrey Blitz's seriocomedy Rocket Science proves that many a handicap can be overcome, no matter how daunting the obstacle at hand may initially seem. Newcomer Reece Thompson plays Hal Hefner, a 15-year-old high-school student with a minor yet socially alienating (and painful) disability: he stutters uncontrollably. Determined to work through the problem, Hal opts for an extreme route -- he joins the school debating team, which sends him on a headfirst plunge into breakneck speech competitions -- and offers a much-needed boost toward correcting the problem. Blitz, like his onscreen alter ego, struggled with a stammer as a young man -- a disability he eventually surmounted -- which imparted him with a lifelong interest in speech and storytelling(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: The gloves come off when two best friends (Kate Hudson, Anne Hathaway) schedule their dream weddings for the same date, at the same place, at the same time and neither is willing to budge(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Produced by Tom Hanks, written by Aaron Sorkin, and directed by Mike Nichols, this adaptation of George Crile III's incendiary bestseller tells the remarkable story of the Texas congressman whose efforts to prevent the Red Army from overtaking Afghanistan eventually led to the collapse of the Soviet Union while simultaneously fueling the rise of radical Islam. In the early 1980s, a hastily assembled army of Afghan "freedom fighters" achieved the remarkable feat of fending off Soviet invaders despite the fact that the odds were overwhelmingly stacked against them. At the time, Texas congressman Charlie Wilson (Hanks) was a key member of the hugely powerful House Appropriations Committee. Illuminated to the specifics of this remarkable war by a high-profile Houston socialite, Wilson spearheaded an effort to provide hundreds of millions of dollars in weapons and training to the Mujahideen with more than a little help from brilliant but prickly CIA operative Gust Avrokotos(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalised when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: 25th Hour
programme.desc: A man has one day to put his life in order before a long stretch in prison in this drama directed by Spike Lee. Monty Brogan (Edward Norton) is a man who came from a working class family in New York. Monty's best friends Jacob (Philip Seymour Hoffman) and Slaughtery (Barry Pepper) went on to distinguished careers as, respectively, a high school teacher and a bonds trader, but Monty took a different path and began dealing drugs. While Monty's trade has made him plenty of money, it hasn't brought him much respect from his family and friends, and while Jacob and Slaughtery have stayed in touch, Monty's lifestyle has led them to keep their distance. One night, Monty is relaxing at home with his girlfriend Naturelle (Rosario Dawson) when the police show up; Monty is arrested, and after a trial he's sentenced to seven years in prison. On his last day of freedom before he goes to jail, Monty tries to make amends with his father (Brian Cox) and goes out on the town with Jacob and Slaughtery. With both of his friends facing emotional crises of their own, Monty finds himself wondering where his life took a wrong turn and if there's any way left to redeem himself. Along the way, Monty begins to suspect that Naturelle may have turned him in, and he has to deal with Kostya Novotny (Tony Siragusa), an ill-tempered drug supplier who has unfinished business with him. 25th Hour was scripted by David Benioff, who adapted the story from his novel of the same name(n)

programme.title: Scream
programme.desc: A serial killer starts killing teenagers in a small town. As the body count rises, one girl and her friends start contemplating the 'Rules' of horror films. Neve Campbell stars. (1996)(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Jason Statham leads the cast of this high-octane action-thriller set in the post-industrial wasteland of tomorrow, with the world's most brutal sporting event as its backdrop. A penitentiary full of felons has inspired the jailers to create a grisly pastime ripe for lucrative kickbacks. Now, adrenalised inmates, a global audience hungry for televised violence and a spectacular arena come together to form the Death Race. From expert action director Paul W.S. Anderson and the producers of Mission: Impossible comes Death Race! The stakes don't get any higher than this!(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, an intelligent but self-conscious deskbound CIA analyst (Melissa McCarthy) is finally given the chance to go undercover as a homely "cat lady" in order to save her missing partner (Jude Law) and thwart a global disaster at the hands of a dangerous arms dealer. Written and directed by Paul Feig(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: Ted (voice of Seth MacFarlane) ties the knot with Tami-Lynn (Jessica Barth), and recruits his best friend John (Mark Wahlberg) as a sperm donor in order to start a family in this sequel to the comedy hit about a teddy bear come to life. Later, when the Commonwealth of Massachusetts demands that Ted appear before a judge to prove he's a real person, the frisky bear and his pal vow to fight for their civil rights. Morgan Freeman and Amanda Seyfried co-star(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is murdered during an apparent road-rage incident, and the officers unravel a conspiracy involving arson. American crime drama starring Sam Waterston.(n)

Meanwhile, Stella and Danny investigate the murder of a promising figure-skater who has been found dead at the ice rink - and come to suspect she was not the intended target. Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes and Anna Belknap star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Lt Col Mann arrives to assist with inquiries into the murder of a marine - a case that becomes personal for Gibbs when he learns one of the witnesses is his ex-wife Stephanie. The team discovers the prime suspect was having an affair with the dead man's spouse, but the case is complicated by the revelation that the victim may have been selling top-secret military information. Starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: Andy and Chris face a difficult decision while investigating a nightclub beating when evidence suggests a cop is the likely perpetrator. Meanwhile, the senior officers compete in a retraining exercise led by new acting sergeant Frank Best.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Popped Pugilist.
programme.desc: Laura and the team investigate when a female impersonator is found shot dead in his car, and quickly discover that the victim was part of an underground fight club. Billy and Meredith go undercover to find out more about a woman seen wearing the same orange lipstick found in the vehicle belonging to the dead man, but soon turn their attention toward a man who claimed to be the deceased's real manager. Starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The detectives probe the shooting of a motorist, and arrest a man who helped the victim change a tyre on his car shortly before he was killed. The suspect protests his innocence, and points the investigators in the direction of another man who admits to the crime and even signs a confession, but further inquiries cast doubt on his guilt. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the death of a book editor who was reputedly having an affair with one of her authors, and find themselves focusing on the lover's long-time companion, whose alibi turns out to be a tissue of lies. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac and Danny try to catch the killer of a conman whose body has been found lying in a pile of money - a mystery compounded by the discovery that he had been building an ark in his back garden. Across the city, Stella and Flack examine the body of a man dressed in a cigarette costume who appears to have burned to death, and follow a trail that leads to the headquarters of a tobacco company.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Muslim US Marine is found seemingly shot dead near a mosque that has been linked to an al-Qaeda recruiter. Ducky refuses to perform an autopsy out of respect for the man's religion, but Abby runs tests that reveal his demise was actually due to poisoning from a rare octopus venom. Meanwhile, McGee goes into the mosque intending to plant a concealed microphone - but discovers someone has had the same idea.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team set up a stake-out at a storage facility to catch a thief suspected of selling hi-tech Navy equipment on the black market, but end up witnessing a murder. To make matters worse, $90million worth of radar gear goes missing while they are distracted. Meanwhile, Ducky asks Abby to run a series of mysterious blood tests, raising suspicions that he is harbouring a secret.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: A prisoner transfer goes awry and a notorious paedophile escapes from custody. The team members face a race against the clock when he kidnaps another girl, and eventually track him down to a hotel - only to discover the victim has been taped to an explosive device. Elsewhere, Chris's family obligations lead him to contemplate joining another division. Crime drama, starring Missy Peregrym and Travis Milne. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The CEO of a private military contractor is found drugged and sexually assaulted in a park, but Benson and Amaro's investigation is hampered by the victim's unwillingness to cooperate. As the case progresses, they uncover a much larger crime and conspiracy in Iraq. Drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Danny Pino.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Amaro investigate an assault on an aspiring actress who had recently auditioned for a reality TV show, and eventually arrest the producer - whose distraught son takes drastic action to get him out of jail. Crime drama, guest starring Harry Connick Jr, with Mariska Hargitay and Danny Pino.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

programme.desc: The unit is called to examine the mysterious death of a sailor serving on a research vessel engaged in a top-secret mission. programme.desc: A childhood friend of Gibbs' dead daughter is stalked by a marine who recently returned from Iraq, and asks the agent for help. Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly star.(n)

programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. programme.title: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian
programme.desc: This adventure comedy finds perpetual underdog Larry Daley getting quite a shock when his mantle as a late-night museum security guard is put to the test after the exhibits come to life once again and begin wreaking havoc. Determined to save the Smithsonian museum from destruction, Larry takes on a loose T. Rex, Attila the Hun and Roman gladiators eager to wage the epic battles of years gone by(n)

programme.title: Free Willy
programme.desc: Heartwarming tale about a troubled young boy and his friendship with a captive orca whale named Willy. On bad terms with his new foster parents and set to work in an aquarium under court order, the boy turns to the whale for companionship. But when he uncovers a cruel plot by its owner to kill the whale in order to claim a big insurance payout, the lad becomes determined to save Willy's life and release him back into the wild(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.title: Big Top Pee-wee
programme.desc: In the sequel to Pee-wee's Big Adventure, Pee-wee Herman finds his peace and quiet interrupted by the arrival in his farmyard of a circus led by ringmaster Mace Montana. Allowing them to stay, Pee-wee falls for trapeze artist Gina Piccolapupula, much to the chagrin of his fiancée Winnie. But all's well that ends well in Randal Kleiser's family fantasy. Reuben's career as Pee-wee came off the rails in 1991 but he has resurrected it, most recently in Pushing Daisies(n)

programme.desc: Join the debate as the major news and issues of the day from the Barclays Premier League are discussed.(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must re-evaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her. Meanwhile, she must make some hard decisions about her ailing father's long-term care(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Tense thriller about a violent and uncompromising police officer's pursuit of a psychopath who subjects the city of San Francisco to a killing spree. The officer's unorthodox methods do not endear him to his superiors, but the Mayor reluctantly agrees that Harry seems to be the right cop for the job. A seminal 1970s law-and-order film that led not only to four sequels but a slew of imitations(n)

programme.title: Cobra
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone stars as a cop named Marion Cobretti -- Cobra for short -- in this action-thriller whose mile-a-minute pacing, dash of humor, and impressive stunts will entertain the most demanding fans. His partner is Gonzales (Reni Santoni) and both work for a special unit that is called in when ordinary methods fail. Cobra and Gonzales are assigned to track down a serial killer and at the same time protect Ingrid (Brigitte Nielsen), who seems a likely bet to become victim number 17. The action heats up when they discover that the "one" serial killer is really a whole gang of neo-Nazi locos(n)

programme.title: Paper Towns
programme.desc: Adapted from the young adult novel by John Green, Fox 2000's Paper Towns tells the story of the bizarre mystery that unfolds in the wake of an acute youthful trauma. After stumbling across the body of a suicide victim, two young neighbors gradually begin to drift apart. Years later, the girl appears at the boy's window in a ninja costume, and requests his help in punishing those who were cruel to her. The following day she disappears without a trace, leaving him in a state of emotional flux as he follows a bizarre trail of clues in hopes of tracking her down(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: Retired male stripper Magic Mike decides to help his friends put on one last show, as the crew embark on a road trip to Myrtle Beach to perform at an exotic-dance convention. Along the way, they brighten the lives of several women in this sexy sequel(n)

programme.title: Scream 3
programme.desc: In Hollywood, Sidney Prescott must once again confront her demons when the stars of a horror movie sequel based on her life begin to die(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars as a cop with vengeance on his mind in John Moore's video game-based CGI noir. The eponymous NYPD detective's life is torn apart by the brutal murder of his wife and child. Determined to track down those responsible and wreak bloody revenge, he leaves no stone unturned. His dedication pays off when investigating a tip-off about some drugs dealers(n)

programme.title: The Gallows
programme.desc: A horrible accident during a school play 20 years prior inspires current students at the school to honor the anniversary by resurrecting the same play. It doesn't take long before they realize that their plan is a deadly mistake. Directed by Travis Cluff and Chris Lofing. Cassidy Gifford, Pfeifer Brown and Ryan Shoos co-star(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers
programme.desc: A brother and sister discover a lair full of modified bodies and before they know it are on the run from a terrifying beast on a ritualistic killing spree(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: Jodie Foster is put through the wringer by suspense director David Fincher ("Seven") in this taut thriller. When thieves break into their Manhattan brownstone, a single mother (Foster) and her daughter hide in a high-tech, fortified "safe room." But as it turns out, the money the crooks are after is in that room. Kristen Stewart, Forest Whitaker, Dwight Yoakam, Jared Leto(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: Naomi Watts shines in this thriller about a reporter who investigates her niece's mysterious death, which seems to be linked to a videotape. Apparently, anyone who watches the tape dies horribly seven days later. Martin Henderson, David Dorfman, Brian Cox, Jane Alexander, Lindsay Frost, Amber Tamblyn(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Dean Corso, a book dealer working in New York, is asked to locate the three remaining copies of demonic manuscript - 'The Nine Gates Of The Kingdoms Of Shadows' by a wealthy collector. Before long everyone who comes into contact with the manuscripts ends up dead and his own life is in danger. The hunt soon turns into an obsession and a search for the truth about the manuscript's powers(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: In the science-fiction thriller Species (1995), Natasha Hentsridge appeared as the beautiful but deadly Sil, a human-alien DNA combo. In this sequel, Hentsridge portrays Eve, a government experiment concocted to gain an understanding of how to combat future aliens, while Michael Madsen and Marg Helgenberger repeat their roles from the earlier film. When astronaut Patrick Ross (Justin Lazard) returns from the first manned Mars expedition, he's infected with the same DNA that spawned Sil and Eve. Hailed as a hero, Ross is pressed into politics by his father (James Cromwell), a senator. Any woman who beds the sexually active Ross is immediately impregnated, with embryos quickly developing and killing the mother. Ross hides the offspring on a family estate, as LA cops begin to detect a pattern in the female deaths. At the lab where scientists are monitoring Eve, Dr. Laura Baker (Helgenberger) realizes that Eve has a telepathic link with Ross, and that these two hybrids hope to couple. Press Lennox (Madsen) and Colonel Burgess (George Dzundza) figure Eve can be used to lead them to Ross. Cleared as a murder suspect, Mars mission astronaut Dennis Gamble (Mykelti Williamson), joins Lennox and Baker and gets in on the action as everyone involved closes in on Ross. Richard Belzer does a cameo as the President of the U.S., while Peter Boyle makes an uncredited appearance as a scientist(n)

programme.title: Love and a Bullet
programme.desc: Tough gangster kid Malik 'The Ghost' Bishop swaps street crime for life as a hitman. Ordered to ice the boss' girlfriend, he finds himself falling for her and planning to quit gangland. But there's going to be bloodshed before they let him go. Crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Village of the Damned
programme.desc: Remake of the 1960 classic about the takeover of a town by telepathic aliens posing as human children. Based on the novel "The Midwich Cuckoos" by John Wyndham(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: After losing faith in Christmas and tearing apart his letter to Santa, a young boy accidentally summons the malevolent holiday demon Krampus and his minions. The fearsome creatures proceed to wreak havoc on him and his dysfunctional family(n)

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Espionage comedy starring Eddie Murphy and Owen Wilson. An inexperienced CIA agent (Wilson) is assigned to track down the arms dealers who stole a high-tech US fighter plane that has the technology to become invisible. The only problem is he has to team up with a cocky, and often idiotic, professional boxer, of whom the arms dealers are known to be fans. Also stars Famke Janssen and Malcolm McDowell(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: Samuel L Jackson plays the eponymous hero in John Singleton's tough thriller, an ex-cop who sets out to nail Christian Bale, a killer using his rich kid connections to escape conviction. But as Shaft's net draws tighter, he has to contend with killers employed by a desperate Bale(n)

programme.title: The Score
programme.desc: Action packed thriller starring Robert De Niro and Edward Norton. A professional criminal decides to leave the business for good until a young thief makes him an offer he can't refuse(n)

programme.title: The Enforcer
programme.desc: Dirty Harry must foil a terrorist organisation made up of disgruntled Vietnam veterans. But this time, he's teamed with a rookie female partner that he's not too excited to be working with(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: Kyle Reese is assigned to protect Sarah Conor from an unstoppable cyborg sent back from the future to terminate the mother of resistance leader John Connor(n)

programme.title: Species: The Awakening
programme.desc: A brilliant and beautiful college professor makes a terrifying discovery about herself after experiencing a frightening blackout in the latest installment of the shocking Species series. Miranda Hollander (Helena Mattsson) is a genius who is about to discover just how little she truly knows about the universe. Upon awakening from a mysterious blackout, Miranda is horrified to find herself surrounded by a mass of mutilated human bodies. When Miranda approaches her uncle in hopes of discovering an answer to this disturbing development, she is shaken to learn that she is in fact a half-human/half-alien clone. Now, the only hope for Miranda is to flee to Mexico with her uncle and seek out the scientist who created her. But it won't be long before Miranda is unable to suppress the killer instincts boiling up within her, and with an endless horde of murderous hybrids on their trail, it's only a matter of time before planet Earth becomes the ultimate extraterrestrial battleground(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: In this supernatural thriller, Tom Witzky (Kevin Bacon) is a fairly typical working-class guy living in Chicago with his wife Maggie (Kathryn Erbe) and his son Jake (Zachary David Cope). One night at a party, Tom gets into a lively discussion with his sister-in-law, Lisa (Illeana Douglas), who believes in psychic communication and the power of hypnosis. He challenges Lisa to hypnotize him, and she plants in him a post-hypnotic suggestion to be more open-minded. But the results aren't quite what Lisa or Tom expected; Tom now senses an air of terrible dread throughout his house and is convinced that evil lurks just around the corner. He also sees the spirit of a girl from the neighborhood who disappeared months ago -- and Jake sees the spirit as well. Stir of Echoes was based on a novel by Richard Matheson, whose work inspired such disparate films as Somewhere in Time and The Incredible Shrinking Man; it was written and directed by David Koepp, who wrote the screenplays for Jurassic Park and Mission: Impossible(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy (David Mazouz) stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force. This tale of terror was directed by Wolf Creek's Greg McLean. Kevin Bacon, Radha Mitchell, and Lucy Fry star in a Blumhouse Productions film(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: In this terrifying horror sequel, husband-and-wife paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren help a single mother living in 1977 London, who claims that she and her children are being terrorized by supernatural forces(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: A lab-created human/alien hybrid goes on a killing spree while searching for a man who can impregnate her. Meanwhile, the scientist responsible for her creation brings together a motley crew in order to stop her(n)

programme.title: Lost Temple to the Gods
programme.desc: French explorer Franck Goddio searches for the lost city of Heracleion, now underwater near Alexandria in the Bay of Abukir, and unearths extraordinary archeological treasures(n)

programme.title: Top Tens
programme.desc: Top Ten Helicopters. Helicopters evacuate the wounded, carry troops in and out of battle, and serve as menacing fire platforms. But which choppers rank as the world's greatest? 7/8(n)

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.desc: The Chalice of Valencia. Author Janice Bennett hopes to prove that the Holy Chalice of Valencia was used by Jesus at the Last Supper(n)

programme.title: Myth Hunters
programme.sub-title: The Holy Grail and Royal Blood
programme.desc: The Holy Grail and Royal Blood. A French cleric's wealth in the late 19th century is investigated(n)

programme.title: America's Most Badass
programme.desc: Guts and Glory. A series comparing the accomplishments, character and legendary status of notable figures in U.S. history begins with Al Capone, Ernest Hemingway, Benjamin Franklin and Abraham Lincoln(n)

programme.title: Evolution of Evil
programme.desc: Stalin: Russia's Steel Tyrant. A profile of Joseph Stalin (1878-1953), the Soviet tyrant who ruled for 29 years and was responsible for some 20 million deaths(n)

programme.title: Evolution of Evil

programme.title: Evolution of Evil

programme.title: Evolution of Evil

programme.desc: Jesse James - The South's Last Rebel. A profile of Jesse James explores his time as a Confederate guerrilla during the Civil War and his emergence as a well-known outlaw in the Midwest in the 1870s(n)

programme.sub-title: John Wesley Hardin - The Dark Heart of Texas
programme.desc: John Wesley Hardin - The Dark Heart of Texas. John Wesley Hardin (1853-95) becomes a notorious cattle rustler in Texas and Kansas in the 1870s, known for his bad temper and habit of settling quarrels with his gun(n)

programme.sub-title: Billy the Kid - The Phantom of Lincoln County

programme.desc: Wild Bill - Marksman and Marked Man. A profile of frontiersman James Butler "Wild Bill" Hickok chronicles his Old West adventures as a gambler, lawman, scout and gunfighter, and how he helped to shape his own legend(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.desc: Sue Barker asks the questions in the light-hearted quiz, with golfer Matt Fitzpatrick, England bowler Steve Finn, former World Champion swimmer Mark Foster and long jumper Jazmin Sawyers joining team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell in a test of their sporting knowledge.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The residents rally together for the sponsored bike ride to raise money for the fayre, but what should be fun is anything but for one local after an upsetting realisation. Meanwhile, Tina excitedly prepares for Shirley's return home from prison.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Restaurant critic William Sitwell sets the brief as John Torode and Gregg Wallace introduce the second quarter-final, from which the best contestants go through to Knockout Week. His challenge for the amateur cooks is to make an exceptional dish, either cooking a savoury recipe that has no meat or fish, or a tart dessert. After preparing their dish, the candidates must stand before William, John and Gregg and hear what they think of their offering and how well they have adhered to the brief.(n)

programme.title: Decline and Fall
programme.desc: Wealthy and beautiful widow Margot Beste-Chetwynde's world is one in which Paul is not overly comfortable. A socialite, her glamorous home is almost constantly filled with the fashionable upper echelons of society, leaving him struggling to adapt to the environment, while striving to win her heart. Perhaps most importantly, he also wonders whether Margot is all that she seems. Jack Whitehall, David Suchet, Eva Longoria and Douglas Hodge star in James Wood's adaptation of Evelyn Waugh's comic novel.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: New series. Just a month following the end of his last run, the diminutive Irishman returns with a brand now run of 13 shows. Here, Graham catches up with Michael Caine and Morgan Freeman, stars of new heist comedy Going in Style. Plus, comedian Jack Whitehall and Game of Thrones actress Gemma Whelan talk about their roles in BBC One's Evelyn Waugh adaptation, Decline and Fall. The nation's favourite man band Take That feature, while Graham also subjects more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better be good.(n)

programme.title: Witless
programme.desc: New series. Leanne and Rhona learn a corrupt cop has leaked their safe house location, leaving them with no choice but to go on the run. Kerry Howard and Zoe Boyle star.(n)

programme.title: The Stepford Wives
programme.desc: A ruthless TV boss suffers a nervous breakdown and is persuaded to relocate to an idyllic town. However, she begins to suspect something is very wrong with the local women and sets out to discover the dark secret behind the seemingly perfect community. Frank Oz's comedy remake of the 1975 satire, with Nicole Kidman, Matthew Broderick, Bette Midler, Glenn Close and Christopher Walken.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Olia Hercules and Frederick Forster and wine expert Jane Parkinson. With clips from Rick Stein, The Spice Men, Nigella Lawson and The Hairy Bikers.(n)

programme.sub-title: When You Want to Show Off.
programme.desc: Mary and her husband celebrate their 50th wedding anniversary, and she shares her secrets on how to create surprisingly easy showstoppers, including canapes inspired by the 1960s. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests look ahead to this weekend's fixtures, which include Sunderland v Manchester United, Manchester City v Hull City and Bournemouth v Chelsea.(n)

Britain are aiming to reach the semi-finals for the third successive year, and this clash is likely to be decisive in deciding the victors.(n)

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals discover a plane and, following a swift repair job by the penguins, manage to escape the desolate shores of Madagascar. However, they crash-land on the plains of Africa and find themselves face-to-face with their wild counterparts for the first time. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a music edition of the celebrity general knowledge quiz, with contestants Mick Foster, Tony Allen, Pauline Black, Harvey, Jonathan Ansell, Faryl Smith, Lee Latchford-Evans and Michelle Heaton trying to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public.(n)

programme.title: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: Game show in which Nick Knowles challenges two pairs of complete strangers to team up, with each pair battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get to play for £50,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Connie makes an effort to show how much she cares on Grace's birthday, but Grace rejects her, and David returns for his first day back at work with his resignation letter for Jacob. Meanwhile, Robyn worries there is something wrong with baby Charlotte, but Duffy and Charlie reassure her it is just a minor cough.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Actor-turned-documentarian Ross Kemp joins Agnes in her studio lounge, where his survival skills are put to the test. Chef Aly whips up another culinary storm as comedian Kevin Bridges - and his mother Patricia - join him in the kitchen for another installment of The Cathy Brown Show, and wildlife expert Steve Backshall may have cause to regret joining Dermot and Buster's Celebrity Safari. Plus, another Thought for the Day from Father Damien and Father Trevor, and Pixie Lott closes the show, performing her new song Baby.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day

programme.title: I Am Number Four
programme.desc: A teenager with special powers is forced to live as a fugitive, constantly moving from place to place with his protector to avoid aliens who seek to destroy him. Sci-fi thriller, starring Alex Pettyfer, Timothy Olyphant and Teresa Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets

programme.title: Money for Nothing

programme.title: Back to the Land with Kate Humble
programme.desc: The presenter follows innovative businesses in the Lake District through Spring, Summer and Autumn, painting portrait of the rugged landscape and gaining an insight the challenges they face. Kate Humble helps with lambing at a fifth generation farm who have invented the world's only wool compost, so they can keep their farming traditions alive. She also goes foraging for wild food, which went to waste until one woman realised she could turn it into unique jams and preserves that are now sold nationwide. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A 100-year-old Nordic rocking chair that its owner's grandparents were given on their wedding day is restored. A mother of pearl shell and a ceramic bulldog are also redeemed.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Masters
programme.sub-title: Golf: The Masters Highlights: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents action from the opening day at the Augusta National in Georgia, where England's Danny Willett entered as the reigning champion at the first Major of the year. The Sheffield golfer recorded a stunning victory here in 2016 to claim his first Major title and become the first British winner of the event since Nick Faldo in 1996. With commentary by Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Andrew Cotter and Paul Azinger.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don offers advice on the best apples and pears to grow in small spaces when he begins to plant up his new fruit garden and gets on with planning for colour when he adds some summer flowering bulbs. As April gets underway, Carol Klein chooses the primrose as her plant of the month and the programme meets a couple from Yorkshire who have a passion for growing fruit and have filled their garden with over 100 fruit trees. As part of the programme's 50th anniversary, Joe Swift makes the case for his Golden Jubilee plant, the one he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half-century. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the final, in which the two most successful teams of contenders use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may appear at first not to be linked. One set of clues comprises The Property of a Lady, The Hildebrand Rarity, Risico and 007 in New York. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The giant armadillo, an animal so elusive few have ever seen it wild in the Brazilian wetlands region known as the Pantanal. David Attenborough reveals how the burrows the armadillos dig create homes for hundreds of other animals. Until recently man knew virtually nothing of this species, but Arnaud Desbiez, the founder of the Giant Armadillo Project, has changed all that.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Sarah Millican, Eddie Kadi, Noel Fielding and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry mucks about with a messy mixture of M-themed matters. As usual, the host poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the final heat, with reigning champion Apollo taking on rival contenders Ms Nightshade, Coyote, Rusty, Crackers'n'Smash, Meggamouse, Trolley Rage and Carbide through two group battles and a mini-league. The battles are all overseen by judges Professor Noel Sharkey, Professor Sethu Vijayakumar and Dr Lucy Rogers.(n)

programme.title: Paula Rego: Secrets and Stories
programme.desc: Making use of new interviews and a vast archive of home video, film-maker Nick Willing compiles an intimate portrait of his mother, the celebrated painter Paula Rego. While Rego has been notoriously private and guarded about her personal life, she opens up to her son, discussing secrets and stories from her live, which has seen her battle fascism, misogyny in art world, and manic depression. Willing's film dictates his mother's story from her native Portugal, where she used her pictures as a weapon against dictatorship, through to settling in London, where she turned her craft toward tackling women's issues such as abortion rights.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: Marine Le Pen: Who's Funding France's Far Right? - Panorama.
programme.desc: The French people vote for a new president in a few weeks and far-right National Front (FN) candidate Marine Le Pen has her sights set on victory and is trying to distance herself from the party's racist and anti-Semitic past. In this programme, Gabriel Gatehouse explores how the FN's desperate need for money could be undermining this process, meeting fixers and insiders who have helped Le Pen run her campaign and raise money from controversial sources around the world.(n)

programme.title: Imagine
programme.sub-title: Imagine - Maya Angelou: And Still I Rise.
programme.desc: A portrait of the trail-blazing activist, poet and writer, who was captured on film just before she died in 2014, combining her words with rare photographs and videos. The film reveals hidden episodes of Maya Angelou's exuberant life during some of America's defining moments, from her upbringing in the Depression-era South, to her work with Malcolm X in Ghana, and her inaugural speech for President Bill Clinton. Contributors include Oprah Winfrey, Bill Clinton, Quincy Jones, Hillary Clinton and Angelou's son, Guy Johnson.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Tinker Bell and the Secret of the Wings
programme.desc: The fairy becomes curious about the mysterious winter forest where fairies never dare to go. She travels into the cold woods, where she meets a new friend and uncovers a threat to both their homes that they must work together to prevent. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Mae Whitman, Lucy Hale, Anjelica Huston and Timothy Dalton.(n)

programme.title: G-Force
programme.desc: A team of secret-agent guinea pigs armed with hi-tech gadgets is sent on a mission to stop an evil billionaire taking over the world. However, before the rodents can complete their mission, they end up on sale in a pet shop. Children's adventure, starring Bill Nighy, with the voices of Sam Rockwell, Nicolas Cage and Penelope Cruz.(n)

programme.title: Shark Tale
programme.desc: Ambitious fish Oscar dreams of escaping his humdrum undersea life. His wish comes true when a gangster shark keen to escape a world of organised crime seeks his help in faking his own death. But Oscar soon finds himself out of his depth as his fearsome reputation gets out of control. Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Smith, Robert De Niro, Martin Scorsese, Renee Zellweger, Angelina Jolie and Jack Black.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: The Bat Man of Mexico.
programme.desc: Since he first kept vampire bats in his bathroom as a child, Mexican biologist and ecologist Rodrigo Medellin has dedicated his life to saving all species of the flying mammal. In this film, David Attenborough narrates his quest to save the endangered lesser long-nosed bat, which is crucial to the production of tequila as it pollinates the plants the drink is made from. Medellin tracks the bats' epic migration across Mexico - braving hurricanes, snakes, Mayan tombs and seas of cockroaches.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore a neglected house in Knotty Ash, Liverpool, a near showroom-condition property in Aberdare, south Wales, and a former shop in Glasgow.(n)

programme.title: Raymond Blanc: How to Cook Well
programme.desc: The chef gives a masterclass in poaching, one of his favourite techniques, because of the way it conserves and enhances the flavours of delicate ingredients while keeping them in perfect shape. He starts with a simple poached egg and tomato fondue, then demonstrates how to make chicken with morel mushrooms cooked with vin jaune wine from his native Jura region in France, before preparing a dessert of poached peach with peach granita.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives, focusing on items suitable for picnics, including Paul Hollywood's quail's egg pork pies.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Masters
programme.sub-title: Golf: The Masters Highlights: 2017 Day Two.
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents action from the second day at the Augusta National in Georgia. With commentary by Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Andrew Cotter and Paul Azinger.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Rolling Stones autographs cause excitement at an antiques fair in Winchester and expert Christina Trevanion develops a fondness for an old teddy bear. James Lewis finds ceramic sheep slightly disturbing, and presenter Paul Martin visits Chawton House to explore the link between author Jane Austen and an American millionaire.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The University of Edinburgh takes on Balliol College, Oxford, in the second semi-final of the competition, which was won last year by Peterhouse, Cambridge. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the final, in which the two most successful teams of contenders use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may appear at first not to be linked. One set of clues comprises The Property of a Lady, The Hildebrand Rarity, Risico and 007 in New York. Last in the series.(n)

As April gets underway, Carol Klein chooses the primrose as her plant of the month and the programme meets a couple from Yorkshire who have a passion for growing fruit and have filled their garden with over 100 fruit trees. As part of the programme's 50th anniversary, Joe Swift makes the case for his Golden Jubilee plant, the one he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half-century. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Live Davis Cup Tennis
programme.sub-title: France v Great Britain: Day Two.
programme.desc: France v Great Britain. Sue Barker introduces further coverage of the second day of the World Group quarter-final, featuring the doubles rubber at the Kindarena in Rouen.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at Mashpi Lodge in Ecuador, which is 900 metres above sea level and features a gondola cable car that transports guests a mile through the rainforest canopy. The pair reveal the challenges of delivering the highest standards of experience in the midst of teeming wildlife, mud and moisture, as well as the eco-tourism that is saving thousands of species, and also spend time with their new co-workers at home, hearing moving stories of how local people's lives have been transformed by the arrival of the hotel.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The giant armadillo, an animal so elusive few have ever seen it wild in the Brazilian wetlands region known as the Pantanal. David Attenborough reveals how the burrows the armadillos dig create homes for hundreds of other animals. Until recently man knew virtually nothing of this species, but Arnaud Desbiez, the founder of the Giant Armadillo Project, has changed all that.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Masters
programme.sub-title: Golf: The Masters Live: 2017 Day Three.
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the third day from the Augusta National in Georgia, as the opening Major of the year continues. Jordan Spieth was the defending champion here last year and seemed destined to retain his crown as he led at the end of the third round, meaning he topped the leaderboard at The Masters for a seventh consecutive round, making it a new tournament record. However, a disappointing round of one-over par saw him finish day three just one stroke clear of compatriot Smylie Kaufman, who himself had carded a three-under 69, and was chasing his first Major success. Meanwhile, Bernhard Langer was the leading European contender on an overall score of one-under, and Danny Willett was tied for fifth alongside Jason Day and Dustin Johnson, though few would have expected the man from Sheffield to claim the first Major of his career as Spieth collapsed on day four. With commentary by Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Paul Azinger and Andrew Cotter.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Mike Read and Janice Long introduce performances by KC and the Sunshine Band, Elvis Costello and the Attractions, the Lotus Eaters, Malcolm McLaren, Robert Plant and Bananarama.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Dancer 2017
programme.desc: Contest showcasing the very best of British dance talent, culminating in a grand final to be staged at Sadler's Wells. Contenders Anaya Bolar, Shyam Dattani, Jaina Modasia, Akshay Prakash and Anjelli Wignakumar showcase two of the most popular classical Indian dance styles - Kathak and Bhatanatyam. Judging this South Asian category are choreographer, performer and academic Chitra Sundaram, performer, teacher and leading exponent of Kathak dance Kajal Sharma, and choreographer and dance producer Shobana Jeyasingh. Hosted by Anita Rani.(n)

programme.title: Depeche Mode at the BBC
programme.desc: A look back at past performances by the band, who emerged from the UK's post-punk scene over three decades ago. From their first appearance on Top of the Pops in 1981 to performing on Later with Jools Holland in 2009, this programme shares archive testimony and recent interviews from core members Dave Gahan, Vince Clarke, Martin Gore and Andy Fletcher. New Life, Just Can't Get Enough, Blasphemous Rumours and Personal Jesus are among some of the classic hits performed.(n)

programme.title: Depeche Mode at 6Music Festival 2017
programme.desc: Highlights of the band's headlining performance in Glasgow, playing the iconic Barrowland Ballroom on the last Sunday in March. The band's first live UK show in four years saw them perform tracks from their new album Spirit, along with some classic hits. The last time Dave Gahan, Martin Gore and Andy Fletcher performed at the 2,000 capacity venue was in 1984 for their Some Great Reward tour.(n)

programme.title: Depeche Mode 101
programme.desc: DA Pennebaker's documentary following the Basildon band as they prepare for the final date of their Music for the Masses tour at the Pasadena Rose Bowl in California in 1989. The film charts how their profile increased during the late 1980s, leading to them becoming one of the most popular alternative rock acts in the world, and also follows a group of young fans travelling across the USA by bus to attend the concert.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Mike Read and Janice Long introduce performances by KC and the Sunshine Band, Elvis Costello and the Attractions, the Lotus Eaters, Malcolm McLaren, Robert Plant and Bananarama.(n)

programme.title: Depeche Mode at the BBC
programme.desc: A look back at past performances by the band, who emerged from the UK's post-punk scene over three decades ago. programme.title: The Silk Road
programme.desc: Sam Willis travels through Central Asia. In Tajikistan, he meets the last survivors of the Sogdian people, a culture that proved vital to the success of the Silk Road and traded from the China Sea to the Mediterranean. He also visits the Uzbek cities of Samarkand and Bukhara, discovering how the conqueror Timur captured large numbers of craftsmen to build them, and discovers how trade between nations led to the birth of astronomy and modern mathematics.(n)

programme.title: Dust Storm
programme.desc: Documentary about the dangerous weather phenomena. The programme explores the Middle east, the part of the world most heavily affected by dust storms, and questions what causes them, the damage they can cause to people's health and how they can be prevented.(n)

programme.title: Wild Scotland
programme.desc: Gordon Buchanan takes a trip home to the island of Mull where he has just one day to film the rare sea eagle. While searching for a nest site, he spots a host of other wildlife species.(n)

programme.title: Department Q: The Keeper Of Lost Causes
programme.desc: A police officer in disgrace after a disastrous shootout is reassigned to work on sorting unsolved case files. He refuses to stay deskbound, and he and his new assistant investigate the suspicious death of a politician five years previously. Murder mystery basded on Jussi Adler-Olsen's series of novels, starring Nikolaj Lie Kaas and Fares Fares. In Danish, Swedish and Arabic.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: Chart highlights from September 1, featuring music by Modern Romance, Madness, Genesis, Big Country, Stray Cats and UB40. Presented by John Peel and David Jensen.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983

programme.title: Psychedelic Britannia
programme.desc: The rise and fall of arguably the most visionary period in British music history, when between 1965 and 1970 a handful of dreamers re-imagined pop music. The psychedelic era produced some of the most ground-breaking music ever made, pioneered by young improvising bands like Soft Machine and Pink Floyd, then quickly taken to the charts by the likes of the Beatles, Procol Harum, Small Faces and Moody Blues. This film, narrated by Nigel Planer, features contributions and freshly shot performances from artists who lived and breathed the psych revolution.(n)

programme.title: Delivery Man
programme.desc: An aging slacker and former sperm donor discovers that he is the biological father of 533 children, and that 142 of them have filed a lawsuit to learn his true identity in this Dreamworks comedy starring Vince Vaughn. Aside from the fact that he was a regular visitor at a fertility clinic 20 years ago, there's nothing particularly remarkable about David Wozniak (Vince Vaughn): He drives a meat-delivery truck for his father's butcher business, he can't seem to hold down a relationship, and lately he's taken to growing marijuana as a means of paying off an $80,000 debt. He's so inept at even the simplest things that his girlfriend Emma (Cobie Smulders) can't stand the sight of him after she reveals that she's pregnant with his child. When an attorney tracks David down and reveals that he is the biological father of 533 children, and that 142 of them have filed a lawsuit to learn his true identity, the former donor panics, recruiting his lawyer friend Brett (Chris Pratt) to defend the privacy agreements he signed at the clinic. When Brett returns with an envelope containing profiles of all 142 children named in the lawsuit, however, David can't help but look, and before long he's surreptitiously injecting himself into the lives of his unsuspecting offspring. Meanwhile, as he begins to grow excited at the prospect of having his own child, he finds that sometimes the best fathers are the men who seem the least fit for parenting(n)

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: Shaunagh Connaire reports from Lebanon where an estimated one and a half million Syrian refugees have fled the war. She reveals that, despite offers of assistance from the international community, some of those most in need - refugee children with serious medical conditions - are dying while they wait for help. Several developed nations have promised to help the most vulnerable children and resettle them. However, it seems there are limits on medical grounds as to who is being accepted, resulting in some of the sickest children and their families being left stranded.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces

Plus, a unique German water tower and a Texan house made of beer cans.(n)

The trio offer their own unique insight into some of the most difficult and delicate issues in modern Britain, and answer that most important of questions: Is it OK?.(n)

programme.title: First Dates

Meanwhile, 38-year-old sales manager Scott, who is looking for someone to mend his broken heart after the failure of an eight-year relationship, meets 28-year-old PA Victoria, and 55-year-old receptionist Debbie has her first date with a woman, in the shape of 59-year-old divorced security guard Ann.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance

Fantasy thriller sequel, starring Nicolas Cage, Idris Elba, Ciaran Hinds and Christopher Lambert.(n)

programme.title: Time Crashers
programme.desc: The final challenge takes the celebrities back to the Iron Age to experience life in 43AD. Greg Rutherford and Meg Mathews are elected as the group's tribal chiefs and they have two days to prepare a Celtic feast, as well as dealing with the more pressing concerns of heat, light and food. Jermaine Jenas struggles to get to grips with making fire and Chris Ramsey has trouble skinning a deer in the dark. Last in the series.(n)

With Fran reeling in shock and Rob still unable to find the right time to talk about his almost-secret collapse, all roads are leading to a dramatic series finale. Comedy starring Rob Delaney, Sharon Horgan, Ashley Jensen and in one of her final roles, Carrie Fisher. Last in the series.(n)

Brought up with French culture in Mauritius, Shahine wants the children to share her enjoyment of it, and to pick up the language. With a budget of £88,000, Scarlette Douglas sets out to help the family find their perfect house.(n)

Long-distance partners Jason and Jaye are looking for a one-bed pad with outside space in Clapham or Brixton to finally bring them together, while Hannah and Frank want a family home before they get married - but have viewed nearly 50 properties without finding the one they want.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of 37-year-old Angelo Mastropietro, as he transforms a damp, dark and abandoned cave in Worcestershire. Having recently been diagnosed with multiple sclerosis, Angelo wants to create a retreat to help him cope with the news and become a 21st century caveman. He has a budget of £100,000 and plans to almost single-handedly carve, cut and drill into the hillside to make the cave comfortable for contemporary living. However, there is no manual for a project of this kind, and the unique challenge soon becomes an obsession.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau

So far, only nine rooms have been renovated and many areas of the 12-acre estate have yet to be looked at - but the project is going to have to start paying for itself soon. They make plans to host weddings on the grounds, while looking ahead to keeping livestock and growing their own crops. Dick takes steps to generate solar power during a hot summer, and turns an old oil tank into a pig roaster.(n)

programme.title: Penelope Keith at Her Majesty's Service

She discovers the daily routine of the household staff during a royal visit, and flicks through a scrapbook of mementos dating back to 1925, which provides an insight into how life in the royal family has changed over the years. She also meets the Queen's bugler, finds an unexpected treasure from the 1953 coronation tour and discovers how in 2012, the Queen played a simple but vital role in uniting two fractured communities in Enniskillen simply by crossing the road.(n)

Crime drama, guest starring Ralph Waite (The Waltons), with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Jon Bentley attempts to filter the bewildering array of prices charged for different coffeemakers, testing three machines costing £100, £600 and £3,500 respectively. Ortis Deley discovers the virtues of smart fabrics, in terms of cars seats that can jolt a driver at risk of nodding off and socks designed to help diabetics prevent foot ulcers. Plus, in her continued quest to try to improve the fortunes of lowly Monkey Tree FC, Georgie Barrat steps things up a gear, with specific tech for improving the boys' football skills.(n)

programme.title: Tony Robinson: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: The actor explores the Yorkshire Dales and in the town of Hawes, meets the team who came together to save local production of Wensleydale cheese by organising a management buy-out of the creamery after the parent company closed it down. Tony also visits the market town of Leyburn on calf auction day, before heading to Aysgarth Falls, a triple flight of waterfalls carved out of the River Ure. In the Swaledale valley, Tony joins in rehearsals of the Muker Silver Band, discovering the origins of this traditional brass outfit.(n)

programme.title: Spectacular Spain with Alex Polizzi
programme.desc: On the Costa Blanca, the presenter reveals how thriving port Valencia has much more to offer than just its sandy beaches. She samples horchata, a sweet drink made from tiger nuts and another local speciality - paella. She also visits the cathedral, where a small chapel houses an ancient chalice believed by some to be the Holy Grail. Further south is Benidorm, where Alex explores its transformation from a quiet fishing village to a high-rise holiday resort. Finally, she visits the tiny island of Tabarca, only a short boat trip away from the mainland but part of a very different world.(n)

programme.title: Dog with an IQ of 142
programme.desc: Brainbox pets and others animals, from a canine Einstein that makes the news after mastering a shape-sorting puzzle that most toddlers struggle with to a prize pooch entered into a competition for trick dogs. Scientific research is also proving how supposedly dumb animals like goats and donkeys are cleverer than people might think. This is demonstrated by a Kent woman who has taught her pet raccoon a remarkable range of skills, such as pushing a toddler's scooter and even riding a bicycle.(n)

programme.title: A Year in the Wild

programme.desc: Autumn is on hold as summer continues, with unexpectedly balmy conditions throwing a life line to the roe deer as they prepare for the winter ahead. For other animals, mating season has arrived, making for a dangerous and testosterone-fuelled time at Ravenscar Beach.(n)

programme.desc: The youngster's new shoes soon lose their sparkle once she goes out to play.(n)
