programme.desc: One of cinema's all-time sci-fi horror classics, Ridley Scott's film stars Sigourney Weaver, Tom Skerritt, Yaphet Kotto, Veronica Cartwright, Harry Dean Stanton, John Hurt and Ian Holm as the crew of the Nostromo, a deep-space tow-craft that intercepts a distress call from a deserted planet. On landing, they find a crashed spaceship and some strange eggs. And then John Hurt leans over one... Spellbinding, edge-of-seat horror follows as the alien begins to hunt down the crew until there's just one survivor (and a cat) left to face its terrible appetite. Premiere(n)

Cloned by a fanatic geneticist in order to retrieve the alien baby inside her, Ripley re-awakens to find mutant DNA in her blood. With the help of a group of bandits who have smuggled on board the ship, including Winona Ryder as Call, Ripley must do battle against the forces of evil once more. However, with the alien actually inside her, Ripley finds she must face up to the demons within herself as well as facing old enemies(n)

programme.title: Hairspray Live
programme.desc: A production of the hit Broadway musical, originally recorded live for US television. In 1962 Baltimore, plump teenager Tracy Turnblad's dream is to dance on the Corny Collins Show, a TV programme popular with local teens. Against all odds, she wins a role on the show and becomes a celebrity overnight, meeting a colourful array of characters along the way. Tracy's mother - the indomitable and stuck-in-the-past Edna - has her eyes opened by her daughter and her new friends, and encourages Tracy in her campaign to integrate the all-white Corny Collins Show. The duo investigate the possibility that rival bidders for the victim's highly desirable farm are to blame - though affairs of the heart might offer a more likely motive. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.(n)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Shaun Evans steps into the shoes of John Thaw in this 1965-set prequel to Inspector Morse, playing a younger version of the cerebral detective involved in the hunt for a missing schoolgirl. Soon deep in a full-blown murder investigation, Endeavour is sidelined, discredited and at a dead end - so he risks all to begin his own quest for justice. programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate a murder committed on the first night of a quiz weekend held at Chaucer College. Sealing the college grounds to interrogate the remaining 11 contestants, the pair discover the victim had a track record for sexual harassment involving fellow competitors, as well as past dealings with a shady engineering business funded by Russian gangsters and masterminded by Oxford professor Charles Milner - another quiz fan. With guest stars Alan Davies (QI), Timothy West (Bleak House) and Nicholas Farrell (The Iron Lady).(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: An idyllic summer day in Oxford is torn asunder when a parcel bomb claims the life of eminent mathematician Adam Capstone, a genius in the field of `Knot Theory'. As Lewis and Hathaway investigate, they discover that, while the victim's academic reputation was beyond reproach, his private life was far more dubious. It emerges Capstone was a man of carnal appetites, who had a string of affairs with young students, betraying his chemistry professor wife Elizabeth, providing her with a clear motive to do away with her cheating spouse. As the detectives work to identify the killer bomber, the case becomes a personal challenge for Lewis, who fears he may not be rewarded with another contract should he fail to impress Moody before his six-month trip to New Zealand. Detective drama, starring Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox, with Zoe Tapper, Tristam Summers and Oliver Lansley.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 96/97 & 97/98. Volume 3 takes us from goal 157 to goal 236, including Eric Cantona's famous chip against Sunderland and another league title for the Reds.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 04/05 & 05/06. Volume 7 takes us from goal 509 to goal 576, including Wayne Rooney's majestic volley against Newcastle as he announced himself as the next United superstar.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 06/07 & 07/08. Volume 8 takes us from goal 577 to goal 669, as the Reds reclaimed their Premier League crown and Cristiano Ronaldo scored goal after goal, including 21 in a season.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim, Fuzz and the team work on a 1963 Alfa Romeo Giulia Spider that has been kept in a dusty barn in Essex after its owner's plans to restore it were interrupted by the onset of a serious medical condition.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nursing manager Sarah hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Leeds, taking inspiration from her husband's Middle Eastern heritage to offer her guests a Turkish fusion menu. Joining her is 28-year-old painter decorator Alex, 45-year-old bridal shop owner Abbi, 60-year-old community centre manager Janet and 56-year-old record label boss Phil. A hilarious evening lies in store, with unexpected tattoos, beauty tips and twerking.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Would-be clairvoyant Janet hosts the second of a week of dinner parties in Leeds and hopes her ghoul-themed dinner party will help her win the cash prize. Part of Janet's plan is to pretend her house is haunted and she has a practical joke lined up for nursing manager Sarah and bridal shop owner Abbi to find. With more surprises in store, will the fright-night theme be enough to ghost Janet into the lead?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Record label owner Phil hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Leeds, hoping to win the £1,000 prize money by serving up a 1970s rock-themed menu. His guests are astounded by his mystery past, and painter and decorator Alex is unimpressed when wedding shop owner Abbi continues to wind him up.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Painter and decorator Alex hosts the fourth night in Leeds, hoping to win the prize money by serving up a cruise-themed menu from around the world - which impresses jealous rival Janet so much, she almost turns violent. Abbi continues to belittle the host - until he reveals he spends his evenings on stage impersonating a famous heart-throb singer. Will his performance bag him the top prize?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bridal shop owner Abbi hopes to woo her guests with a wedding-themed party on the final day of the competition in Leeds. All week Abbi and Michael Buble impersonator Alex have had a bit of a banter that has sailed close to the wind. Will the tension take over, or can the wedding theme create an amorous atmosphere that will help Abbi win the £1,000 prize?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi offers more advice to people buying a second property abroad, this time helping to find the perfect holiday home to be shared by three sisters and their brother in the Poitou-Charentes region of south-western France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sama Damergi helps Paula Brown to pursue her dream of retiring to the Vendee region of western France. With a budget of £80,000, Paula hopes she will be able to buy a property in which she can keep chickens and grow vegetables.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Athelney, Somerset: Back to Our Roots.
programme.desc: In an edition first shown to mark the 100th episode of the archaeology show, Tony Robinson and the team revisit Athelney in Somerset, where King Alfred established a stronghold from which he campaigned to drive the Vikings out of England and unite the local kingdoms as a single nation. When Time Team first looked at Athelney, no digging was allowed at the site, but now excavations of the famous fortified abbey uncover a startling revelation about its origins.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Kew Gardens, London: Looking for the White House.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit the site of a forgotten palace built for George III at Kew Gardens in west London. The kitchen block is the only visible evidence that remains, so the immaculate lawns are ripped up in a search for the foundations.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Hampshire to repair a VW Golf GTI Mk1 that has been kept in a garage since a road accident in 2001. However, they both have different ideas about how the finished car should look when it is returned to its owner.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick faces a new challenge when he is called upon to save the life of a buzzard with a broken wing. A couple's beloved labrador turns up at the clinic with badly damaged elbow joints, and a pampered cat that is used to living the good life faces surgery to repair slipping knee-caps.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Bengal cat called Tia is rushed in to Fitzpatrick Referrals after being hit by a car. Noel Fitzpatrick faces the painstakingly difficult task of reconstructing Tia's tiny bones using a combination of rods and pins. Whippet Wobble, a rescue dog, is so badly injured that Noel has no choice but to perform a high-risk operation, and Alfie, a labrador care-dog, arrives at the surgery in need of help with elbow dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Julie and Mark Veysey, whose vision is a Miami-style beach house overlooking the south Devon coast. The design resembles a series of white interlocking boxes topped with a flat zinc roof, and a barbecue and hot tub on the veranda, as well as a cinema room, are also part of the project. However, with a budget of just £200,000, they may have a hard time realising their dreams.(n)

programme.title: The Team
programme.desc: The detectives' search for Loukauskis is narrowed down to an abandoned factory in the Belgian countryside. Jackie finds his ex-wife Dahlia dead in her garden, but the murderer turns out to be an unlikely killer. Meanwhile, Alicia and Harald arrive at the factory and are stunned by the scale of the slavery operation in evidence. At first there's no sign of Loukauskis, but this time the team is determined he must not escape. Thriller, starring Lars Mikkelsen, Jasmin Gerat and Veerle Baetens. In English, German, Flemish, French and Danish. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ninety-one-year-old Cyril is airlifted to hospital after a car crash which required him to be cut from his car. Meanwhile, the medical team treat 57-year-old Caroline, who arrives at St George's with chest pains, plus five-year-old Roman has a pencil stuck in his ear.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Mechanic Grant, 34, is rushed in after being crushed against a brick wall by his own car, which he was working on at the time. Doctors are concerned he has a serious pelvic injury and other internal wounds and work quickly to establish how severe they are. Meanwhile, 44-year-old Doug, who has a rare growth on his head and face which is prone to profuse bleeding, arrives in A&E, and 23-year-old cage fighter Charlie is treated in minor injuries for something in his eye.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The owners of Jack's Waterfront at St Clair Shores in Michigan are keen to hear the fiery chef's advice for turning their failing seafood restaurant around. The lakeside location is a popular summer spot with fantastic views, but an uninspiring menu and a manager more skilled at socialising than organising are preventing them from achieving year-round success.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and Roisin Conaty compete against Jon Richardson and Nish Kumar. Adam Buxton joins the show's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Ninety-one-year-old Cyril is airlifted to hospital after a car crash which required him to be cut from his car. Meanwhile, the medical team treat 57-year-old Caroline, who arrives at St George's with chest pains, plus five-year-old Roman has a pencil stuck in his ear.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates how fresh supermarket fish really is, and Kate Quilton travels to Peru's Ica Valley to discover how asparagus can be cultivated all year round in one of the driest places on Earth. Matt Tebbutt heads to a secret location to track down UK-grown wasabi plants - and manages to sting his nostrils in the process.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Mushgon Dadfar hosts the first dinner party in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire, and has high hopes for her Caribbean-themed evening. However, the guests have little time to let their meal settle before they face an energetic Zumba session.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housewife Pip Massey welcomes the diners to her home for the second dinner party of the week in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire. As a fortysomething woman who lunches and is used to entertaining, she has high hopes that all those years of practice will make her glamorous evening a success.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Landscape gardener Darren Leech hosts the third dinner party in and around Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire. He hopes to impress his guests with fine food, including smoked haddock and black pudding, and entertainment that involves laughing at his bottom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Student Emma Davies hosts the fourth dinner party in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire, hoping to woo her guests with a creative menu featuring stuffed pork and a home-made gnocchi starter as well as treating them to a musical performance.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hypnotherapist Russell Stubbs hosts the final dinner party in Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire, hoping to impress his guests with a rock-night theme. In a bid to improve his chances of claiming the £1,000 prize, he prepares a meal using British produce, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton examines properties on the Solway coast of Dumfries and Galloway, including a modern home that sits on top of a 100 foot cliff in In Sandyhills Bay. He also heads for the picturesque port of Kirkcudbright, where he explores a home that takes its inspiration partly from local lighthouses and a Russian architectural masterpiece. Plus, a restored 15th century tower house at Barholm, near Gatehouse of Fleet, and a shoreline Cotswolds-style house at Arbigland.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp goes property hunting in the trendy suburb of Heaton in Newcastle, to help Tom and Liz find a new home as they are tired of renting flats. Elsewhere, Phil Spencer is in the Tyne Valley searching for a family home for couple Michael and Sorrel, who only have two months left in their current rental property.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Sara Damergi and Kerr Drummond give advice to a couple who are buying their first home together in Cornwall, but he wants to live by the beach while she loves the countryside.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at stately home Anstey Hall in Cambridge, with father and son team John and Johnny de Bruyne. The fun starts with a character-revealing afternoon of goose-herding, before the participants dress to impress at a formal dinner. John recounts stories of royal connections - which fails to impress hotel managers Mark and Layla. In the morning, as they tuck in to a self-service breakfast, guest Tim decides that DIY doesn't work at Anstey Hall, but when he notes this on his feedback form, John and Johnny accuse him of game-playing.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to clothes-free Clover Spa and Hotel in Birmingham, where owner Tim Higgs hopes to convert his rivals to the joys of naturism. Judging with an extra critical eye are John and Jonny De Bruyne, who received negative feedback from Tim, and a thorough room inspection reveals a dusty porn DVD. Tim tries to encourage his nervous guests to take part in a naked spa experience, but John opts to watch television instead. When feedback is invited, Tim is delighted to discover Mark and Layla would stay again but shocked by the `porn film' discovery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the Angel Hotel in Coleford, Gloucestershire for the third day of the competition, where a treasure hunt organised by hosts Mark and Layla brings out their guests' competitive sides. Meanwhile, there is confusion at breakfast and Layla's manners are criticised.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Higher Gitcombe in Totnes, Devon, where owners Paul and Lynnie Jolly set out to spoil their guests. Everyone is overwhelmed by the added extras, but naturist Tim is put off by cushions and clutter. After a masterclass in Nordic walking, Lynnie serves up a veg smoothie, which unhealthy eaters Mark and Layla dubiously down in one. Over dinner, Tim challenges his host's organic 'niche'. And Layla, still smarting from his negative feedback, labels him 'weird, naked Tim'. At breakfast, guests are wary as Tim's order goes wrong and Jonny and Layla engage in an eating competition. When feedback is invited, the Jollys are affronted by accusations of special treatment and vow to put the record straight.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet one last time to find out what they have been paid. Geri kicks off proceedings by demanding to know why Sarah and Luke did not want a return visit to Greenways of Malvern, before they in turn confront Sanjeev and Elinor over their low cleanliness score for Ferry Lodge. Then the Court Colman Manor proprietors accuse Sarah and Luke of unfairly judging their hotel, before the payments are revealed and the winners are announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee teacher Kirsty Davenport kicks off a week of dinner parties in Eastbourne, East Sussex, where she hopes that a simple menu will impress her guests - property finder Ann-Marie Hamilton, sales consultant Russell Turnbull, part-time lecturer Adam Holt and hairdresser Becci Moloney.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ann-Marie Hamilton hosts day two in Eastbourne, where she plans to entertain her guests by singing in her garden. Fellow contestant Russell makes a lot of jokes, but foodie Adam does not seem amused.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Becci Moloney hosts the third dinner party in Eastbourne, East Sussex, and prepares a menu of hearty food for her guests. Her outdoor bar makes a positive impression on rivals Kirsty and Ann-Marie, but Russell and Adam are puzzled by her collection of recycled toilets in the garden.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Adam Holt hosts the fourth dinner party in Eastbourne, East Sussex, where his fellow competitors' expectations are high. However, some of them are surprised by his menu - which fails to amount to much more than sausages and mashed potato.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Raconteur Russell Turnbull hosts the final night in Eastbourne, East Sussex. Having played his cards close to his chest all week with regards to his culinary skills, his plans for a fancy menu intrigue his rivals. However, for all the bravado, it remains to be seen whether he can actually cook.(n)

programme.title: Hunt for the Arctic Ghost Ship
programme.desc: Cameras follow the multi-million-dollar expedition that discovered the Victorian ship HMS Erebus, intact and upright on the Arctic sea floor in September 2014. The story unfolds in the freezing Arctic, where search vessels battled with heavy sea-ice that threatened to stop the search entirely, to the dramatic chain of events that led to the historic discovery.(n)

programme.title: Titanic: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Investigative journalist and Titanic expert Senan Molony examines recently recovered photographs of the doomed ship, which provide fresh insight into the reasons for its sinking. The images reveal a strange mark on the hull, which may prove previously overlooked stories of a fire raging in the boiler room. This blaze may explain why the captain chose to ignore warnings of icebergs ahead and why the vessel sank so quickly after the fatal collision.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extreme
programme.desc: An exploration of the most unusual airports on the planet, including a runway squeezed between skyscrapers, a landing strip carved into mountains and an airport where the runway disappears with every tide. Plus, a military base that has been under repeated attacks for 10 years.(n)

programme.desc: Time Machine. Time travel used to be a taboo. Relegated to the realm of science fiction. Many serious scientists now believe that time travel is not only possible, but inevitable. In this one hour programme physicists such as Stephen Hawking and Michio Kaku talk about the possibility of time travel. They both agree that time travel to the future is possible. Traveling close to the speed of light will slow down the rate of time experienced. But other physicists are trying to find ways to travel back in time. To do this they attempt to warp space and time by using gravity. Time travel into the past does however raise some difficult issues. Could the time traveler alter history?(n)

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)

Sean gives his take on female role models for his daughters, and introduces routines by Lee Nelson, who provides his views on street riots, and Irish funnyman Ed Byrne.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: A September 2012 edition of the topical comedy quiz show, as guests Greg Davies, Andi Osho and Stewart Francis join host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison to offer their take on the week's news stories.(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Donna and Joe tie the knot, while April attempts to keep the wedding running smoothly, and Ron creates an awkward situation between Tom and Lucy.(n)

programme.title: Closing Time
programme.desc: New series. Every weekend, Britain's hard-drinking party animals lay siege to towns and cities across the country - and suffer the consequences. On Newcastle's Bigg Market there's everything from broken ankles on the dance floor to broken noses on the street. An army of people, from doormen to cabbies and paramedics to takeaway owners, try to make sure the night goes well - and are there to pick up the pieces when it doesn't.(n)

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.sub-title: Horrible Histories: Rotten Rulers: Wicked William the Conqueror.
programme.desc: An edition of the historical comedy focusing on the 11th-century Norman monarch, including his quarrels with Harold Godwinson about who should be king of England and the Battle of Hastings in 1066. Plus, a look at how Chinese technology was far ahead of the Normans and Saxons in England, and the programme meets one of the world's first scientists in Egypt. Guest starring Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.title: Junior MasterChef
programme.desc: The four contestants have one hour to cook their own favourites in an attempt to impress and grab a place in the semi-finals. Dishes include smoky mackerel pate, ackee and saltfish quiche, and a citrus lassi.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Triple bill. The latest comings and goings in sun-kissed Summer Bay.(n)

programme.title: Champions League Magazine
programme.desc: Focusing on European football's elite club competition, featuring highlights, news and previews of forthcoming matches, as well as a look through the archives at classic battles featuring some of the game's greatest players.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers with Alan Davies
programme.desc: Eight puppies and their underweight mum are found confined in a small space, and Graeme Petty is determined to get justice for little Haribo, a terrified Staffordshire bull terrier rescued from a house in Liverpool. Meanwhile, Herchy Boal tries to discover why Blade has chronic fur loss, and cameras follow Roo, a dog born with three legs who is determined to never give up.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio of motoring enthusiasts embark on another epic road trip, this time across western America in front-engined supercars. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for the latest incarnation of Aston Martin's Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and there's a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac drummer Mick Fleetwood rolls up his sleeves to thrash the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: First Knight
programme.desc: A wandering swordsman is knighted for his fighting prowess at the court of King Arthur and his wife, Lady Guinevere. However, the new knight and the queen develop a dangerous and secret attraction for each other, while a neighbouring warlord threatens the downfall of the kingdom. Adventure, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery, Julia Ormond and Ben Cross.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: From the windswept highland valleys of Bhutan to the glacial peaks of Karakoram, this programme investigates the climatic variations of the Himalayan region that is home to some of the most distinctive creatures on Earth.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC weatherman Peter Gibbs makes an emotional return to the British Antarctic Survey's Halley Research Station, where he lived and worked in the early 1980s. During that period, the station was key to the discovery of the Ozone Hole, and today it is making vital findings about how people's lives are vulnerable to the Sun's activities, as well as studying interplanetary travel and the threat of man-man climate change. In addition to returning to the place he once called home, Peter is on a rescue mission, since the station is under threat of being cast adrift on a huge iceberg.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Air
programme.desc: New series. Wildlife series following animals that are able to defy gravity in various ways. The first programme features caracal cats, which jump to catch birds out of the air, and reveals how kangaroos' hopping movements help them find water in the desert. Leaping snakes are able to glide without wings in the jungles of Borneo while insects are able to accelerate up to 700G.(n)

programme.title: Zero Dark Thirty
programme.desc: A CIA operative joins a team of intelligence and military operatives in the aftermath of the September 11 attacks. She spends the next 10 years searching for information on the whereabouts of Osama bin Laden, ultimately leading to the final raid on the terrorist leader's hideout. Kathryn Bigelow's fact-based drama, starring Jessica Chastain and Mark Strong.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Bury.
programme.desc: Two years ago, Michelle and Rod Malone set about adapting their home after daughter Maddie contracted a rare brain disease that left her struggling to walk and talk. However, unforeseen problems with the project left them living in just a couple of rooms in an unsafe house. Enter Nick Knowles and the DIY SOS builders, bolstered by an army of local tradespeople, to complete what the Malones started and give it a few finishing touches, courtesy of flamboyant designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS

programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team meet Rob and Michelle Wall and their son Noah. The couple live in a small 18th-century house in Cumbria, which is currently a half-finished renovation project that had to be put on hold when Noah was born with spina bifida. Designer Charlie Luxton is tasked with making the cold and unsafe property a special haven for the family - and as always an army of local tradesmen turn out in force to help make the dream a reality.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A property expert helps Surrey couple Alistair and Debbie, who want to buy their dream home in North Devon, and have a million pounds to invest in it.(n)

programme.title: Inside Asprey: Luxury by Royal Appointment
programme.desc: The daily workings of the high-end London designer, which has supplied jewellery to the royal family since the reign of Queen Victoria. Over one summer on New Bond Street, the sales team tempts VIP customers with one-of-a-kind, gem-encrusted handbags selling for an average price of £33,000, while in the workshop above, silversmiths are seen making much of Asprey's luxury merchandise by hand. The programme also highlights the challenge of crafting a three-piece jewellery suite to hit the shop floor on schedule.(n)

programme.title: 40 Year Old Virgins
programme.desc: Documentary following a 45-year-old man and a 29-year-old woman who have never had sex - and not through personal choice. Clive is intimidated by the thought of physical intimacy and finds it difficult to talk to women, while Rosie dreams of starting a family, but cannot bear to be touched by men. The pair head to America for a radical two-week course of sex therapy designed to help them face their fears.(n)

programme.title: My Tattoo Addiction
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the world of body art. Unemployed father-of-six Paul reveals how his facial tattoos prevent him from securing regular work, Duncan expresses his grief at the loss of a friend through the ink on his body, and James shares his desire to escape from his surroundings with his adornments. Plus, Helen and Amy, whose tattoos are part of their attempt to fit into a world they believe views them as outsiders.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: While snorkelling off a deserted island, McGarrett and his new girlfriend Lynn stumble onto the hideout of a wanted gangster. Elsewhere, Chin, Kono and Grover must track down a gambler who is forcing a high-school quarterback to deliberately lose a play-off game.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett and the team join forces with a conman to solve a murder case, while Chin Ho gets help from a San Francisco police inspector as he investigates the deaths of five Chinese arms dealers. Adam receives unsettling news after meeting with the Yakuza boss.(n)

programme.title: Football's Funniest Moments

Meanwhile, Kensi learns the objective of her mission in Afghanistan - kill an American working with the Taliban.(n)

programme.desc: Grover heads to Chicago to extract a confession from old friend Clay Maxwell, who is suspected of murdering his wife, while two killers hold Chin and Kono at gunpoint, unaware they are police officers, Guest starring Mykelti Williamson (Forrest Gump).(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor uncovers the gossip, intrigue and scandal lurking behind the closed doors of some of the world's most famous rooms and suites. He visits the Chateau Marmont on Hollywood's Sunset Boulevard, where Howard Hughes famously holed up in the penthouse, Jean Harlow and Clark Gable carried out a torrid affair and Lindsay Lohan was recently temporarily banned for not paying a bill. In New York, he talks to former mobster Louis Ferrante about a robbery at the Pierre Hotel in 1972 in which cash and jewellery worth $10million was stolen.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor learns what it means to be treated like a VIP in some of the world's finest hotels. He heads to the Harlequin Suite at London's Dorchester, where Elizabeth Taylor had a pink marbled bathroom installed. He also visits Paris's Le Meurice, the place Salvador Dali returned to every year for 30 years. He meets the surrealist artist's muse Amanda Lear, who talks about his antics, as well as how his legacy is celebrated in the hotel today. In America, Richard gets a true taste of the lifestyle of the megarich when he orders the $5,000 fleurburger at the Mandalay Bay Hotel in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor discovers some of the hidden extras on offer in the world's most expensive hotels. He goes underground at Paris's George V for a tasting session in its fine wine cellars and catches up with the managing director of London's Goring, who reveals why the hotel has become the unofficial royal choice. At the Hotel Bel-Air in Los Angeles, Richard talks to a wedding planner who has organised nuptials for celebrities including Gwen Stefani, Nicole Richie and Katy Perry, and he also chats to Kiss bassist Gene Simmons and Cosmopolitan editor-in-chief Joanna Coles.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Three weeks into the presidential campaign, Santos pulls off a coup that raises his approval ratings, while Vinick ignores warnings of a possible assassination brought to him by an eager NSA agent. The pair compete to bring each other down as they deliver their messages of the week. Political drama, starring Alan Alda and Jimmy Smits.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: When his peace plan for the Middle East is jeopardised by the assassination of a Palestinian leader, President Bartlet insists on attending the funeral despite concerns over his security. Meanwhile, CJ receives disturbing news from a member of the intelligence community. Drama, starring Martin Sheen and Allison Janney.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush receives an anonymous phone call from a man who claims to have murdered his grandmother many years previously and buried her body in the basement of his former home. Kathryn Morris stars.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: An Alzheimer's patient takes part in a clinical trial, but unexpected side-effects trigger an explosive temper and expose a conflict between him and his wife. Meanwhile, House confronts new boss Foreman, and Wilson treats a patient who claims to be in a chaste marriage. Medical drama, starring Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez investigate when a teenage girl dies after being hit by an underground train and uncover evidence that the girl had been a victim of cyber bulling. Frank clashes with the newly appointed inspector general of the NYPD after Erin brings forward evidence that Jamie's partner Eddie may have lied about the details of her first arrest. Guest starring Bebe Neuwirth (Frasier).(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Kate confronts Charles Frost over the conversation he had with CJ. Meanwhile, everyone else tries to come to terms with the identity of the informer, and Babish's questioning of Toby forces him to seek legal advice. Political drama, starring Mary McCormack and Richard Schiff.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Vinick faces a dilemma after a pro-life organisation condemns Santos and he is forced to choose between throwing his support behind the advert and offending an important pressure group. Will has a tough time on his first day as Toby's replacement dealing with press briefings about the shuttle leak.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: Rush re-examines the case of a hitch-hiker murdered in Atlantic City, New Jersey, in 1997 to see if it sheds any light on two more recent killings. Police drama, starring Kathryn Morris and John Finn.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The team is forced to perform invasive surgery on a homeless girl, and discovers a complex relationship with her mother when she arrives at her estranged daughter's bedside. Meanwhile, Taub has a difficult time trying to connect with his infant daughters. Medical drama, starring Hugh Laurie and Peter Jacobson.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez investigate the kidnapping of a child whose parents aren't as willing to co-operate with the detectives as they would like. But when links to a Croatian mobster are discovered, their reticence becomes more understandable. Meanwhile, Jamie and Eddie go undercover in a jewellery shop in an attempt to stop a string of robberies, and Frank tries to help an NYPD chaplain who admits to being in crisis following his arrest for drink-driving. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Galapagos
programme.desc: The broadcaster reveals how life has learnt to adapt quickly in the ever-changing volcanic landscape, resulting in species that exist nowhere else in the world. David investigates the driving forces behind their evolution, exploring the appearance and behaviour of remarkable creatures and vegetation including giant whale sharks, marine iguanas and seemingly normal dandelion seeds that grow into plants the size of trees.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Ser Dontos spirits Sansa out of King's Landing and rows her out to a waiting ship, and Pod gives Tyrion news of his forthcoming trial. Tywin counsels Tommen on what makes a good king and also has an offer for Oberyn Martell. Sam decides Castle Black is not a safe places for Gilly, while Jon proposes a bold plan after the wildlings send a chilling message. Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys picks a champion to take on the best that Meereen has to offer and Davos has an idea about raising funds for Stannis's cause.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: In King's Landing, Jaime finally visits Tyrion in jail after some persuasion from Bronn, and he also has a mission for Brienne. Daenerys tries to balance justice and mercy in Meereen. At Castle Black, Jon asks for volunteers when Ser Alliser decides to let him go to Craster's Keep to deal with the mutineers. Fantasy drama, starring Emilia Clarke, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau and Kit Harrington.(n)

programme.title: Deadwood
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the crime-riddled town call for a despotic government to rule over the commune and so Farnum is installed as mayor, with Utter as Fire Commissioner. Starring William Sanderson and Dayton Callie.(n)

programme.title: Deadwood
programme.desc: A Chinese immigrant comes to town and, with the help of some pioneering translation techniques, manages to inform Swearengen that his shipment of opium has been stolen by two addicts.(n)

programme.desc: Hood deals with a hitman from Portland who arrives in town looking to recover a debt from a robbery Jason carried out. Meanwhile, Gordon sinks to a new low, and Job shares information regarding Rabbit and the diamond heist. Drama, starring Antony Starr.(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Peter Gregory demands to see a full business plan before stumping up the $200,000 start-up money, and he also wants a slimmed-down team, leading a desperate Richard to turn to former Hooli executive Jared Dunn. Together they set about trimming the fat, and while Gilfoyle and Dinesh prove themselves essential, Big Head's place in Pied Piper is a lot less certain. Comedy, starring Thomas Middleditch.(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Richard encounters yet another glitch when Jared discovers the name Pied Piper is already registered to an irrigation company and he is forced into a negotiation process. Erlich is convinced a new name is needed for the business and embarks on a drug-fuelled quest in the hope of unearthing it. Comedy, starring Thomas Middleditch.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Maritime Inn landlady Pat gets her first full house of the season as Brixham's tourist trade picks up for the summer - but refuses to hire anyone to help her with the extra work. Powerboat instructor Mike Weatherbee tries to enforce the laws of the sea, carpet-cleaner Dave Satchwill prepares to lead the town's popular ghost tour, and lone fisherman Dave Brown reveals his unusual methods.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: August arrives and the fishermen of Brixham spend time ashore with their families as their boats are repaired - but summer proves costly for Jan, who loses £1,000 for every day his vessel is out of action. Apprentice deckhand Logan has to decide whether a life at sea is the right choice for him and his family, and seafood seller Jenny receives a surprise on her 65th birthday.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor explores Ireland's best hotels, beginning by visiting the beautiful Ashford Castle which provided the setting for the 1952 film The Quiet Man. Together with Classic FM presenter John Suchet, Richard then checks in at the Belfast Europa, which is known as most bombed hotel in Europe after being attacked 28 times during the Troubles, before taking a tour of the Clarence Hotel in Dublin, which is owned by U2 frontman Bono. Finally, he visits the exclusive six-star Ballyfin, where guests are granted the chance to be lord and lady of the manor during their stay.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor's series exploring the world's most luxurious hotels concludes on the glamorous French Riviera. Beginning at the Hotel de Paris in Monaco, he is shown the art of perfect fine dining before meeting ex-Formula One driver David Coulthard, who explains why he chooses to call Monaco home. Richard then visits the Hotel Byblos in St Tropez, where Mick Jagger and Bianca De Macias tied the knot in 1971, before paying a visit to Belles Rivers.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor returns to explore more of the world's most luxurious hotels and begins in Miami's South Beach, home to some of the most hedonistic and extravagant establishments in America. At the Fontainebleau, he meets a man with eye-opening stories about Frank Sinatra's regular visits and gets a shock when he discovers how much it costs to hire a booth in the night club. Richard also gatecrashes swimwear fashion week at the Raleigh Hotel, where he speaks to the event manager about the many celebrity parties he has organised.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Rumours concerning Fidel Castro's deteriorating health cause the president to reconsider the economic sanctions that America has imposed on Cuba. CJ makes subtle enquiries into Harper's past, while Charlie is troubled by a termite problem. Drama about the US President and his aides, starring Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Bruno Gianelli advises Senator Vinick about how to ensure he is successful in the forthcoming election and get his religious views across to voters. President Bartlet devises a scheme to tackle the issue of the minimum wage. Political drama, starring Alan Alda and Ron Silver.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: As a response to the strong challenge of the Republicans, President Bartlet asks Leo to organise the Democratic National Convention in the hope of bringing stability to the party. The vice president puts a proposal to Santos, and the president is troubled by problems in space. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Vice President Russell, Hoynes and Santos are in the running for presidential nominee at the Democratic Party National Convention. President Bartlet has to decide whether to launch the secret defence shuttle to rescue the trapped astronauts.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet continues the Press leak investigation to find out how information about the military shuttle became common knowledge. programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The clock is ticking for Rush and Vera, who are assigned to track down a serial rapist before he strikes again. Kathryn Morris stars.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: An ailing widow begins to experience flashbacks of the night her husband was killed, prompting Rush to reopen an old murder investigation. Starring Kathryn Morris.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: A student collapses while having sex with his girlfriend, and the medics struggle to diagnose an illness that has seemingly unconnected symptoms. House suggests a series of treatments that only worsen the condition and finds himself facing defeat when the student has to be isolated because his immune system fails.(n)

programme.title: House
programme.desc: The maternity ward is closed when two babies display mystery symptoms, including high temperatures and seizures. House horrifies the doctors by partially suspending treatment in a bid to determine whether drugs are exacerbating the problem - and when a baby boy dies, Cameron breaks down and is forced to confront a trauma in her past. programme.title: Raising Helen
programme.desc: A New York fashion designer's sister dies, leaving her the legal guardian of three children. Maintaining a glamorous Manhattan lifestyle while looking after the youngsters proves more complicated than expected, forcing her to choose between professional fulfilment and family loyalty. Comedy drama, starring Kate Hudson, John Corbett, Helen Mirren and Joan Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.(n)

programme.title: Lessons in Love
programme.desc: A womanising professor settles down with his younger girlfriend and their son, only for her to leave him for someone else. Her sister visits him to make sure he is being a good father and has not slipped back into old habits, but ends up falling in love with him. Romantic comedy, starring Pierce Brosnan, Salma Hayek, Jessica Alba and Malcolm McDowell.(n)

programme.title: Get Hard
programme.desc: A corrupt businessman is convicted of fraud, and given 30 days to put his affairs in order before starting a prison sentence. He assumes a black employee has a criminal past, and seeks his help in preparing for a life behind bars - not realising that the financially struggling working stiff has never broken the law in his life. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell and Kevin Hart.(n)

programme.title: The House Bunny
programme.desc: A Playboy bunny is ejected from Hugh Hefner's mansion for being considered over-the-hill on her 27th birthday, and has to find a new home and a fresh role in life. She becomes the unlikely house mother for a dowdy college sorority, and sets about giving its inmates a pin-up style makeover and turning their social lives around. Comedy, starring Anna Faris, Colin Hanks, Emma Stone and Kat Dennings.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: A Cappella group the Barden Bellas enjoy an unprecedented run of success, until a disastrous performance sees them banned from national competitions and beset by scandal. They attempt to turn their fortunes around and redeem their legacy by competing in the World Championships of A Cappella in Copenhagen. Comedy sequel, starring Anna Kendrick and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: The officious captain of a seaside town's home guard platoon tries to maintain the reputation and morale of his troops as the Second World War draws to a close. He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
programme.desc: A self-promoting writer is offered a position on the staff of a New York fashion magazine thanks to his irreverent views on the world of celebrity. However, he soon discovers his opinions render him incapable of relating to the superficial personalities he is expected to work with, not to mention his egotistical boss. Comedy based on Toby Young's memoirs, starring Simon Pegg, Kirsten Dunst, Jeff Bridges, Megan Fox and Gillian Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: A London man's misfortunes in love look set to change when he meets an American beauty. However, the prospect of a transatlantic relationship succeeding seems slim, so the pair go their separate ways - only for him to realise he is unable to get her out of his mind. Richard Curtis's comedy, with Hugh Grant, Andie MacDowell, John Hannah, Charlotte Coleman, Kristin Scott Thomas, Simon Callow and James Fleet.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
programme.desc: A Cappella group the Barden Bellas enjoy an unprecedented run of success, until a disastrous performance sees them banned from national competitions and beset by scandal. They attempt to turn their fortunes around and redeem their legacy by competing in the World Championships of A Cappella in Copenhagen. Comedy sequel, starring Anna Kendrick and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: The officious captain of a seaside town's home guard platoon tries to maintain the reputation and morale of his troops as the Second World War draws to a close. He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Awkward Sexy People
programme.desc: Two close friends who have always been unlucky in love resort to a drastic plan to turn their lives around. They decide to spend a summer indulging in as much hard drinking and casual sex as they can, in the hope that the experience will transform them into the confident people they have always longed to be. Romantic comedy, starring Adam Pally and Sarah Burns.(n)

programme.title: The Hangover
programme.desc: Three men on a stag weekend in Las Vegas wake up after a night of heavy drinking and find they have not only misplaced the groom, but somehow gained a tiger and a baby. Unable to remember the details of the night before, they set about piecing the clues together in the hope of finding their missing friend. Comedy, starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms and Zach Galifianakis.(n)

programme.title: Best Defense
programme.desc: An engineer gets mixed up with the KGB and FBI while trying to complete a super-powered tank for the US military, while the soldier given the thankless task of testing the vehicle suffers a series of mishaps. Comedy, starring Dudley Moore and Eddie Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Revenge of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Bumbling Inspector Clouseau's adventures seem to have come to an end when he is mistakenly declared dead. However, the disaster-prone detective is in fact alive and well, and takes advantage of the situation to launch an undercover investigation into his own murder, adopting a variety of cunning disguises. Comedy sequel, starring Peter Sellers, Herbert Lom, Burt Kwouk and Dyan Cannon.(n)

programme.title: Galaxy Quest
programme.desc: The cast of a cancelled sci-fi series are reduced to a life of conventions and public appearances, only to find themselves genuinely transported into space. Naive aliens have mistaken the show for real life and want the actors to help defend them from an evil extraterrestrial warlord. Sci-fi comedy, starring Tim Allen, Sigourney Weaver, Alan Rickman and Sam Rockwell.(n)

programme.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer & Uncut
programme.desc: The crusading grown-ups of the Colorado town lead America into war against Canada in a bid to eradicate bad language from TV. The four young heroes set out to bring peace to the world, but have to battle a fearsome alliance between Satan and Saddam Hussein. Animated musical comedy, with the voices of Trey Parker and Matt Stone, as well as George Clooney, Eric Idle and Isaac Hayes.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: Homer unwittingly pollutes Lake Springfield, so the US government decides to isolate the city underneath a giant dome. The Simpsons manage to escape and plan to start a new life in Alaska - but learn Springfield is about to be destroyed, and return to save their friends. With the voices of Dan Castellaneta, Julie Kavner, Nancy Cartwright and Yeardley Smith.(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Me
programme.desc: A mentally unstable woman whose life revolves entirely around daytime TV wins the lottery. She immediately stops taking her medication and pays a television studio millions to let her broadcast a show sharing her outlandish views and troubled past with the world. Comedy, Kristen Kirsten Wiig and Tim Robbins.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Disgraced entrepreneur Michelle Darnell attempts to launch a comeback with the reluctant help of Claire Rawlings, her former PA. Comedy, starring Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
programme.desc: A Nascar racing champion has everything he could want - until an arrogant French rival seizes the title from him, and his wife runs off with his best friend. Forced to move back in with his mother, the downhearted driver turns to his estranged father for help rebuilding his shattered self-confidence. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, John C Reilly and Sacha Baron Cohen.(n)

programme.title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
programme.desc: A journalist leaves behind her sheltered life in New York to report from the front line in Afghanistan. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Tina Fey and Margot Robbie.(n)

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: An obnoxious TV weatherman reporting on a small town's annual festival finds himself caught in a bizarre time loop, and is forced to relive the same day over and over again. While at first he tries to exploit his predicament, he is ultimately driven to mend his ways and adopt a less cynical attitude. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Andie MacDowell, Chris Elliott and Stephen Tobolowsky.(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Disgraced entrepreneur Michelle Darnell attempts to launch a comeback with the reluctant help of Claire Rawlings, her former PA. Comedy, starring Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage.(n)

programme.title: Bruno
programme.desc: A gay Austrian fashion journalist becomes a figure of hate in his own country, and heads to America in search of celebrity with his adoring assistant in tow. He embarks on a campaign of publicity stunts to make himself famous, encountering prejudice and meeting people similarly desperate for stardom. Spoof documentary, starring Sacha Baron Cohen and Gustaf Hammarsten.(n)

programme.title: Dug's Special Mission
programme.desc: Short animated comedy, featuring characters from Up. The talking dog's fellow canines try to get rid of him by setting him a series of pointless tasks - but the plan keeps backfiring on them. With the voices of Bob Peterson, Delroy Lindo and Jerome Ranft.(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch
programme.desc: A manic, mischievous alien escapes from the galactic police and crash-lands his spaceship on Hawaii. A lonely little girl mistakes the stranded creature for a dog and adopts him - but alien and Earth authorities are soon combing the island in search of him. Disney animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Daveigh Chase, Chris Sanders, Tia Carrere, Ving Rhames and David Ogden Stiers.(n)

programme.title: Partly Cloudy
programme.desc: Pixar animated short about a stork delivering babies created by a cloud, but who starts to wish he had a different source when his cargo always turns out to be a dangerous animal.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Day & Night
programme.desc: Animated short film from Pixar, in which the upbeat, cheerful embodiment of day and the moody, bad-tempered personification of night have a personality clash. However, as they get over their suspicion of each other, they begin to get a new perspective on the world.(n)

programme.title: Monsters, Inc
programme.desc: Two monsters work for an energy firm that employs scary creatures to sneak into children's bedrooms and convert their screams into power. However, when a little girl accidentally wanders into the pair's domain, they have to race against time to return her safely home before anyone finds out. Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
programme.desc: The son of the canine couple leaves home to join a pack of rough-and-ready strays, but he soon discovers the grass is not always greener on the other side. Animated sequel, with the voices of Scott Wolf, Alyssa Milano, Jodi Benson and Jeff Bennett.(n)

programme.title: Sanjay's Super Team
programme.desc: Bored with his father's meditation, a young Indian boy daydreams of Hindu gods as superheroes. Animated short, with the voices of Brent Schraff, Sunny Singh Attar, Arun Rao and Jaquelynn Herrera.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Pocahontas
programme.desc: A Native American princess falls in love with an English settler, but her father is distrustful of the Europeans - not without just cause, as a cruel governor is prepared to wage war to get his hands on the gold he believes they are hiding. Disney animated drama, with the voices of Irene Bedard, Mel Gibson and Christian Bale.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Monsters, Inc
programme.desc: Two monsters work for an energy firm that employs scary creatures to sneak into children's bedrooms and convert their screams into power. However, when a little girl accidentally wanders into the pair's domain, they have to race against time to return her safely home before anyone finds out. Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: The Finest Hours
programme.desc: An oil tanker suffers devastating damage while caught in a fierce Atlantic storm, which breaks the vessel in two. While an engineer tries to keep the crew members trapped in the sinking wreckage alive, members of the Coast Guard brave the deadly conditions to come to their rescue. Fact-based disaster movie, starring Chris Pine, Casey Affleck and Eric Bana.(n)

programme.title: Tomorrowland: A World Beyond
programme.desc: A boy genius in the 1960s finds his way into a spectacular futuristic metropolis while attempting to promote his idea for a jetpack. Decades later, he has grown into a disillusioned adult, while a girl who has the talent and enthusiasm he has lost also finds her way into this strange new world, and together they attempt to uncover its secrets. Fantasy adventure, starring George Clooney, Britt Robertson and Hugh Laurie.(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
programme.desc: A single-minded American golfer's determination helps him to overcome the sport's class prejudice against his working-class background and his father's cynicism for the chance to test his skills against his idol in the 1913 US Open. Fact-based drama directed by Bill Paxton, starring Shia LaBeouf, Stephen Dillane, Elias Koteas and Josh Flitter.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur: Sky Movies Special
programme.desc: Sky Movies takes a special look at Pixar's animated prehistoric adventure.(n)

programme.title: The Big Green
programme.desc: An English teacher provides her American pupils with an introduction to the joys of soccer, giving them the pride and ability to take on the best at the state championships, and winning the heart of the local sheriff along the way. Sporting comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Olivia d'Abo and Jay O Sanders.(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch 2: Stitch Has a Glitch
programme.desc: The odd couple return for this animated sequel, in which the lovable, loopy alien gives his adopted family more problems thanks to a major malfunction. With the voices of Dakota Fanning, Tia Carrere and Holliston Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.(n)

programme.title: Tangled
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi.(n)

programme.title: Cinderella
programme.desc: An orphan is forced to live a life of servitude by her cruel stepmother. The king of the realm she lives in organises a lavish ball to find a bride for his son, and a caring fairy godmother puts her magic to the task of turning the downtrodden girl into a princess. Disney animated fairytale, with the voices of Ilene Woods, William Phipps and Verna Felton.(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A rat finds his love of fine food has made him an outcast to his less discerning family. Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Inside 11-year-old Riley's head lives a team of five that controls her emotions. Led by the eternally upbeat Joy, they have always ensured she lived a happy life - but when Riley's parents move to a new city, she is plunged into depression and the emotions face a crisis that threatens their entire world. Pixar animated fantasy, with the voices of Amy Poehler and Phyllis Smith.(n)

programme.title: Tangled
programme.desc: A baby princess's hair has mystical powers, so an evil witch kidnaps her and locks her in a tower, hoping to use the magic to fend off old age. When the princess is a teenager with 70-foot long tresses, she escapes with the aid of a bandit and goes in search of her home, but the witch is not going to let her go without a fight. Disney animated comedy based on the Rapunzel story, with the voices of Mandy Moore and Zachary Levi.(n)

programme.title: Race to Witch Mountain
programme.desc: An ex-convict cab driver becomes the protector of two aliens disguised as children who claim to hold the key to Earth's continued existence. As he races against time to return the visitors to their spaceship, he must also hold off hostile government agents and a sinister extraterrestrial assassin. Sci-fi adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, AnnaSophia Robb, Alexander Ludwig and Carla Gugino.(n)

programme.title: National Treasure
programme.desc: An intrepid treasure-hunter follows a series of ingenious clues in a perilous quest to track down a war chest hidden by America's founding fathers generations before. He has to contend with determined rivals in the shape of a treacherous associate and the FBI. Action adventure, starring Nicolas Cage, Diane Kruger, Sean Bean and Justin Bartha.(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A rat finds his love of fine food has made him an outcast to his less discerning family. Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

programme.title: The Magnificent Seven Ride
programme.desc: The one-time leader of the gunslinging band, now a marshal, turns down an old ally's call for help in dealing with a gang of Mexican bandits. However, when the desperados kill his friend and his own wife, the lawman puts together a new team and sets out to take revenge. Western sequel, with Lee Van Cleef, Stefanie Powers, Mariette Hartley and Michael Callan.(n)

programme.title: Bloodsport
programme.desc: A talented martial arts expert gets entangled with a tenacious undercover reporter as he takes part in an illegal fighting tournament, where the last man standing wins the day - and the losers usually end up in the cemetery. Action adventure, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Donald Gibb, Leah Ayres, Norman Burton and Roy Chiao.(n)

programme.title: Rocky III
programme.desc: World heavyweight boxing champion Rocky Balboa settles down into a life of luxury - but a cloud appears on the horizon in the shape of ambitious contender Clubber Lang, whose brutal fighting style represents a serious threat to his title. Drama, starring Sylvester Stallone, Mr T, Burgess Meredith, Talia Shire, Burt Young, Carl Weathers and Hulk Hogan.(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
programme.desc: Eric and fellow warrior Sara, raised as members of ice Queen Freya's army, try to conceal their forbidden love as they fight to survive the wicked intentions of both Freya and her sister Ravenna. However, as war between the siblings escalates, Eric and Sara unite with Freya in an attempt to end Ravenna's wicked reign once and for all. Fantasy adventure, starring Chris Hemsworth, Charlize Theron, Emily Blunt and Jessica Chastain.(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: A deskbound CIA agent provides valuable background support for a dashing secret agent, but has never gone into action herself. Everything changes, when the spy mysteriously vanishes, and she leaps into action to take his place, infiltrating the inner circle of a ruthless arms dealer and trying to avert a global catastrophe. Comedy adventure, starring Melissa McCarthy, Jason Statham and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Married explorers Rick and Evelyn battle the newly resurrected mummy Imhotep and his ruthless partner, who have captured their son. The undead creature is heading for a confrontation with a legendary ancient warrior - with power over a magical army to be won. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Brendan Fraser, Rachel Weisz, John Hannah, Arnold Vosloo, Oded Fehr and Patricia Velasquez, with a brief appearance by Dwayne Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Hitman
programme.desc: A genetically engineered assassin, who exists at the beck and call of a mysterious organisation, fails in his latest mission, and becomes a target himself, as security forces worldwide become aware of his existence and a rival agent is assigned to tie up loose ends. Action thriller, starring Timothy Olyphant, Dougray Scott and Olga Kurylenko.(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: A deskbound CIA agent provides valuable background support for a dashing secret agent, but has never gone into action herself. Everything changes, when the spy mysteriously vanishes, and she leaps into action to take his place, infiltrating the inner circle of a ruthless arms dealer and trying to avert a global catastrophe. Comedy adventure, starring Melissa McCarthy, Jason Statham and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War
